verses.latin: Arphaxad igitur rex Medorum domuit multas nationes, et ipse aedificavit civitatem potentissimam, quam appellavit Ecbatana,
verses.english: Arphaxad, the king of the Medes, conquered many nations. He himself built a very powerful city, which he named Ecbatana.

verses.latin: ex lapidibus quadris et sectis: fecit muros ejus in altitudine septuaginta cubitorum, et in latitudine triginta cubitorum:
verses.english: He built its walls with squared and cut stones. The walls were seventy cubits high—a cubit being the length from elbow to fingertip—and thirty cubits wide.

verses.latin: et turres ejus posuit per portas ejus in altitudine centum cubitorum, et in latitudine sexaginta cubitorum:
verses.english: He also placed towers by its gates, each one a hundred cubits high and sixty cubits wide.

verses.latin: et fecit portas ejus in altitudine septuaginta cubitorum, et in latitudine quadraginta cubitorum, ut exirent ad pugnam exercitus ejus, et reliquarum peditum multitudinum instructa agmina.
verses.english: He made its gates seventy cubits high and forty cubits wide, so that his armies and his vast numbers of infantry troops could march out to battle.

verses.latin: Igitur rex Arphaxad, anno duodecimo regni sui, cepit contra Nabuchodonosor regem Assyriorum, qui regnabat in Ninive civitate magna, et in diebus illis superabat et possidebat omnia regna supe riora ab Cilicia et Damasco et Libano, et a Cedes, et per omnes possessiones superiores usque ad magnum flumen Euphraten:
verses.english: In the twelfth year of his reign, King Arphaxad began to wage war against Nebuchadnezzar, the king of the Assyrians. Nebuchadnezzar reigned in the great city of Nineveh. In those days, he was conquering and possessing all the upper kingdoms from Cilicia, Damascus, and Lebanon, and from Cedes, and through all the upper territories as far as the great Euphrates River.

verses.latin: et trans Tigrim et Euphraten et Adria, et in campo Arioch regis Elymaeorum: et regnaverunt nationes multae filiorum Chelod.
verses.english: He also ruled across the Tigris and Euphrates Rivers and Adria, and in the plain of Arioch, king of the Elymaeans. Many nations of the sons of Chelod had also submitted to his rule.

verses.latin: Igitur Nabuchodonosor rex Assyriorum misit ad omnes habitantes in Cilicia et Damasco et Libano, et ad eos qui habitabant in Carmelum et Cedar, et ad habitantes in Galilaea in campo magno Esdrelon,
verses.english: Therefore, Nebuchadnezzar, the king of the Assyrians, sent messengers to all those who lived in Cilicia, Damascus, and Lebanon. He also sent them to those who lived in Carmel and Cedar, and to the inhabitants of Galilee in the great plain of Esdrelon.

verses.latin: et ad omnes qui erant in Samaria et trans flumen Jordanem usque ad Jerusalem, et omnem terram Jesse, quoadusque perveniretur ad fines Aethiopiae.
verses.english: He sent messengers to all those who were in Samaria and across the Jordan River, as far as Jerusalem. He sent them to all the land of Jesse, reaching even to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Ad hos omnes misit nuntios Nabuchodonosor rex Assyriorum:
verses.english: To all these peoples, Nebuchadnezzar, the king of the Assyrians, sent his envoys.

verses.latin: et omnes una voce contradixerunt, et remiserunt legatos ejus vacuos, et sine honore abjecerunt.
verses.english: But all of them, with one voice, refused him. They sent his envoys away empty-handed and dismissed them without honor.

verses.latin: Tunc iratus Nabuchodonosor rex adversum omnem terram illam, juravit per thronum et regnum suum quod defenderet se de omnibus regionibus istis.
verses.english: Then King Nebuchadnezzar, enraged against all that land, swore by his throne and his kingdom that he would take vengeance on all those regions.

verses.latin: Et in anno decimotertio regni sui, fecit ad omnes qui soli militabant in exercitu ejus, virtutis suae Arphaxad,
verses.english: In the thirteenth year of his reign, he gathered together all those who served alone in his army and who were prepared to fight Arphaxad, for his own might.

verses.latin: multitudinem virorum centum viginti millia peditum pugnatorum, et equitum duodecim millia sagitariorum, quos distribuit in campos ejus planissimos.
verses.english: This vast force consisted of one hundred and twenty thousand fighting infantrymen, and twelve thousand archers on horseback. He distributed them throughout his most level plains.

verses.latin: Et munivit agmina ejus super multitudinem aquarum, et ascendit ad regem Arphaxad in campo magno Ragau.
verses.english: He fortified his troops over an abundance of waters, and he marched up to King Arphaxad in the great plain of Ragau.

verses.latin: Et praecessit illi occurrere rex Arphaxad cum campestribus suis, et equitibus et exercitu magno valde et copioso.
verses.english: King Arphaxad advanced to meet him with his infantry, his cavalry, and a very great and numerous army.

verses.latin: Et percussit Nabuchodonosor rex Arphaxad, et virtutem ejus, et omnem equitatum ejus, et redigit eum in fugam:
verses.english: But King Nebuchadnezzar struck down Arphaxad, along with his forces and all his cavalry, and put them to flight.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo regni Nabuchodonosor, qui regnavit in Assyriis in magna civitate Ninive: in diebus Arphaxad, qui regnavit super Medos in Ecbatana,
verses.english: In the twelfth year of King Nebuchadnezzar's reign, when he ruled the Assyrians from the great city of Nineveh, Arphaxad was king over the Medes in Ecbatana.

verses.latin: et aedificavit in Ecbatana muros in circuitu ex lapidibus quadris et sectis latitudinis pedum septem, et longitudinis cubitorum triginta: et altitudinis cubitorum sexaginta sex:
verses.english: This King Arphaxad had built massive walls around Ecbatana using squared and carefully cut stones. Each wall section was seven feet wide, thirty cubits long (a cubit is roughly 18 inches), and sixty-six cubits high.

verses.latin: et aedificavit turres in portis ejus altitudinis cubitorum centum, et latitudinis in fundamento cubitorum sexaginta:
verses.english: He also constructed gate towers that were one hundred cubits tall and sixty cubits wide at their foundation.

verses.latin: et fecit portas ejus in altitudine cubitorum septuaginta, et in latitudine cubitorum quadraginta: ad exitum potentiae exercituum et ad instruendas acies peditum:
verses.english: The actual gates themselves were seventy cubits high and forty cubits wide, specifically designed to allow powerful armies to march out and infantry to form their battle lines.

verses.latin: in his diebus rex Nabuchodonosor pugnabat contra regem Arphaxad, et vicit eum in omni pugna exercitus ejus.
verses.english: During this period, King Nebuchadnezzar waged war against King Arphaxad, utterly defeating Arphaxad's army in every engagement.

verses.latin: Et comprehendit equitatum ejus, et omnes currus ejus, et universum exercitum ejus:
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar captured Arphaxad's cavalry, all his chariots, and his entire military force.

verses.latin: et obtinuit regionem ejus. Et pervenit ad Ecbatana, et turres ejus, et muros ejus diruit, et in ruinam redegit omnia munimenta ejus.
verses.english: He then seized control of Arphaxad's territory. When Nebuchadnezzar reached Ecbatana, he completely demolished its towers and walls, reducing all its strongholds to rubble.

verses.latin: Et comprehendit Arphaxad in montibus Ragau: et interfecit eum, et reversus est in Ninive cum universa praeda exercitus sui, equorum scilicet et curruum et virorum bellatorum:
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar captured Arphaxad in the Ragau mountains, executed him, and then returned to Nineveh. He brought with him all the plunder from his army, including horses, chariots, and captured warriors.

verses.latin: et mansit ibi, ipse et exercitus ejus, dies centum viginti, epulans et bibens.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar and his entire army stayed in Nineveh for one hundred and twenty days, celebrating their victory with continuous feasting and drinking.

verses.latin: Et post dies istos, misit rex Nabuchodonosor ad omnes qui habitabant in Cilicia, et Damasco, et Libano,
verses.english: After these hundred and twenty days of celebration, King Nebuchadnezzar sent messengers to all the peoples living in Cilicia, Damascus, and Lebanon.

verses.latin: et ad nationes quae sunt in Carmelo, et Cedar, et Galaad, et omnem Galilaeam, et in campum magnum Esdrelon,
verses.english: He also sent messages to the nations in Carmel, Kedar, and Gilead, as well as to all of Galilee and the great plain of Esdraelon.

verses.latin: et ad omnes qui erant in Samaria, et trans Jordanem usque ad Jerusalem, et omnem terram Jesse, donec veniatur ad fines Aethiopiae.
verses.english: The messengers were sent to everyone in Samaria, all the people living across the Jordan River up to Jerusalem, and throughout all the land of Jesse (which is Judea), extending as far as the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Ad hos omnes misit nuntios rex Nabuchodonosor:
verses.english: King Nebuchadnezzar sent his envoys to all these diverse peoples and regions.

verses.latin: qui omnes una voce contradixerunt, et renuerunt ire cum eo ad bellum.
verses.english: However, with one accord, every single one of them defied him and refused to join him in his military campaign.

verses.latin: Et contempserunt faciem ejus, et reversi sunt vacui a facie nuntiorum ejus.
verses.english: They openly scorned his authority. Consequently, his messengers returned to him empty-handed, having failed in their mission.

verses.latin: Et iratus est rex Nabuchodonosor super omnem terram illam valde: et juravit per solium et regnum suum, quoniam defenderet se de omnibus regionibus his.
verses.english: King Nebuchadnezzar became extremely furious with all those lands. He solemnly swore by his royal throne and his kingdom that he would exact vengeance upon all of these rebellious regions.

verses.latin: Statimque in anno tertiodecimo misit ad omnem virtutem suam Holofernem principem militiae suae,
verses.english: Therefore, in the very next year, his thirteenth year of reign, Nebuchadnezzar immediately dispatched Holofernes, the commander-in-chief of his army, leading all his military might.

verses.latin: et praecepit illi ut percuteret omnem terram Celi, et omnes suos fines, et solum superba loquentes.
verses.english: He gave Holofernes strict orders to attack and conquer all the territory of Coele-Syria and its surrounding regions, specifically targeting those who had spoken proudly and defied him.

verses.latin: Et profectus est cum millibus peditum centum viginti, et equitum duodecim millibus, cum currigeris suis.
verses.english: Holofernes began his campaign with a massive army: one hundred and twenty thousand infantrymen, and twelve thousand cavalry, complete with their chariots and crews.

verses.latin: Et ascendit ad montana, et transiit cum universo exercitu suo, et equis, et curribus, et disposuit se super omnem terram Gabaa.
verses.english: He led his entire army, with all their horses and chariots, up into the mountainous regions. He marched through them and then deployed his forces across all the land of Gabba.

verses.latin: Et obtinuit omnes fines eorum a montanis excelsis usque ad Chaion, et ad fines Aethiopiae.
verses.english: He successfully conquered all their territories, from the highest mountains down to Chaion, extending even to the borders of Ethiopia—a vast area indeed.

verses.latin: Et veni ad omnes filios Ismael, et ad omnes filios Ceturae, et habitavit in deserto usque ad Ephron, et transgressus est per Arabiam.
verses.english: Holofernes then advanced against all the descendants of Ishmael and Keturah. He established his camp in the desert, extending as far as Ephron, and continued his campaign by crossing through Arabia.

verses.latin: Et circumdedit omnes filios Madian, et succendit omnes civitates eorum in igne, et obtinuit omnia castra eorum.
verses.english: He encircled all the descendants of Midian, set fire to every one of their cities, and seized all their military camps.

verses.latin: Et venit in planitiem Damasci in diebus messis triticum, et succendit omnes segetes eorum, et universos arbores et vineas excidit.
verses.english: He arrived in the plain of Damascus during the wheat harvest. There, he burned all their crops, and systematically cut down all their trees and vineyards, devastating their land.

verses.latin: Et metus ejus incubuit super omnes qui habitabant in Cilicia, et Damasco, et qui in Libano morabantur.
verses.english: A profound dread of Holofernes now fell upon all the inhabitants of Cilicia, Damascus, and those who resided in Lebanon.

verses.latin: Et misit Holofernes nuntios ad omnes qui habitabant in Syria Sobal, et in omnibus regionibus maritimis.
verses.english: Holofernes then sent messengers to all the people living in Syria-Zobah and throughout all the coastal regions.

verses.latin: Et ad eos qui habitabant in Phoenice, et in Gaza, et Ascalon, et juxta maritima loca.
verses.english: He sent them also to those residing in Phoenicia, Gaza, Ashkelon, and other coastal towns.

verses.latin: Et qui erant in Joppe, et in Accharon, et omnes filios Israel, et omnem terram Jesse, donec veniatur ad fines Aethiopiae.
verses.english: The messengers went to the inhabitants of Joppa and Ekron, as well as to all the people of Israel and the entire land of Jesse (Judea), extending once more to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Et exierunt universi obviam Holoferni cum coronis in capitibus suis et cum ramis olivarum.
verses.english: In response, everyone from these regions came out to meet Holofernes, wearing crowns on their heads and carrying olive branches—symbols of peace and surrender.

verses.latin: Et prostraverunt se ante eum, adorantes eum.
verses.english: They prostrated themselves before him on the ground, showing him profound deference and homage.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei: Domine, domine, tolle de nobis quod placet tibi.
verses.english: They pleaded with him, saying, 'Oh great lord, our lord, take from us whatever pleases you.'

verses.latin: Utere servis tuis sicut tibi placet.
verses.english: 'Treat your servants as you see fit.'

verses.latin: Ecce nos et omnia nostra ancillae tuae sumus.
verses.english: 'Behold, we and all our possessions are completely at your disposal.'

verses.latin: Et omnes regiones nostrae, et castella nostra, et civitates nostrae, sunt ante faciem tuam.
verses.english: 'All our regions, our fortresses, and our cities are laid before you.'

verses.latin: Utere illis sicut tibi placet, et sicut melius tibi videtur.
verses.english: 'Use them as you please, and as seems best to you.'

verses.latin: Et omnes in his diebus pacis, et concordiae fuerunt:
verses.english: And so, in those days, all these regions and peoples found peace and agreement with Holofernes.

verses.latin: et universi simul in pace et in unum locum convenerunt.
verses.english: They all gathered together peacefully in one place to signify their submission.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes descendit de montanis eorum.
verses.english: After receiving their submission, Holofernes descended from their mountainous territories.

verses.latin: Et posuit castra sua in omnibus finibus eorum.
verses.english: He then established his military camps throughout all their borders and lands.

verses.latin: Et recepit omnes filios Israel.
verses.english: And at this point, he also received the submission of all the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Anno tertiodecimo regni Nabuchodonosor, vigesimo et secundo die mensis primi, factum est verbum in domo Nabuchodonosor regis Assyriorum ut defenderet se.
verses.english: In the thirteenth year of King Nabuchodonosor's reign, on the twenty-second day of the first month, a decree was issued from the palace of Nabuchodonosor, the king of the Assyrians, concerning how he would defend himself.

verses.latin: Et vocavit omnes majores natu, et universos duces, et bellatores suos, et habuit consilium in occulto de illis:
verses.english: And so he called together all the elders, all the generals, and all his warriors. He held a secret council with them.

verses.latin: Dixitque quoniam cogitatio ejus erat ut omnem terram occuparet;
verses.english: And he told them that his plan was to conquer the entire known world.

verses.latin: Et audierunt universi qui habitabant in Ninive: et sciebant quomodo Nabuchodonosor rex Assyriorum vicisset Arphaxad in campo magno, et adsumpsisset multitudinem omnem virorum orientis,
verses.english: Everyone living in Nineveh had heard this. They knew how Nabuchodonosor, the king of the Assyrians, had defeated Arphaxad on the great plain, and how he had then taken control of all the vast population of the Eastern lands.

verses.latin: Et quomodo accepisset civitates eorum, et provincias, et vicit eas usque ad fines Aethiopiae.
verses.english: They also knew how he had seized their cities and provinces, conquering them all the way to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Tunc Nabuchodonosor rex Assyriorum misit in omnem terram, et ad omnem virum, qui in universis finibus ejus morabatur.
verses.english: So, King Nabuchodonosor of the Assyrians sent messengers throughout all the land, to every man who dwelled within the entirety of his borders.

verses.latin: Et denuntiavit eis, ut praepararent se ad bellum adversus universam terram.
verses.english: And he declared to them that they must prepare themselves for a war against the entire known world.

verses.latin: Qui omnes unanimiter contradixerunt: et irati sunt a facie ejus, et inani eum dimiserunt a facie sua.
verses.english: But every single one of them united to oppose him. They became enraged in his presence, and sent him away, his demands rejected and his purpose unfulfilled.

verses.latin: Tunc Nabuchodonosor, in furore et ira magna, vocavit Holofernem ducem militiae suae, et dixit illi:
verses.english: Then Nabuchodonosor, consumed by furious and immense anger, called Holofernes, the commander of his army, and said to him:

verses.latin: Ecce egressus es de conspectu meo, et noluisti audire verbum pacis.
verses.english: "Look, you have left my presence, and you refused to listen to my words of peace" —this is Nabuchodonosor's perspective, implying the regions didn't listen to his 'offer' of submission.

verses.latin: Nunc autem praecipe ut sumas multitudinem hominum, peditum centum viginti millia, et equites duodecim millia,
verses.english: "Now, command that you gather a vast army: one hundred and twenty thousand infantry soldiers and twelve thousand cavalry."

verses.latin: Et exi in omnem terram contra occidentem, eo quod non obtemperaverint jussioni oris mei:
verses.english: "And then, march out against all the lands to the west, because they have disobeyed the command of my own mouth."

verses.latin: Et denuntia eis, ut se praeparent ad bellum, et mittere mihi decem millia viros de singulis civitatibus, et provincias ex omni terra sua.
verses.english: "And proclaim to them that they must prepare for war and send me ten thousand men from each city and province throughout all their territory."

verses.latin: Et mandavit Holoferni, ut nulli parceret, nisi ei qui sponte se offerret ei in servitutem.
verses.english: And he commanded Holofernes to spare no one, except those who willingly offered themselves to him in servitude.

verses.latin: Et praecepit ei, ut omnes qui se obsisterent morti traderentur.
verses.english: And he ordered him that all who resisted his command should be put to death.

verses.latin: Tunc Holofernes egressus est a facie regis sui, vocavitque omnes majores natu, et duces et bellatores suos.
verses.english: Then Holofernes departed from the presence of his king. He called together all his elders, generals, and warriors.

verses.latin: Et congregavit centum viginti millia virorum electorum, et duodecim millia equitum cum sagittariis suis.
verses.english: And he gathered one hundred and twenty thousand chosen men, along with twelve thousand cavalry, complete with their archers.

verses.latin: Et adsumpsit secum multitudinem camelorum, et mulorum, et asinos sine numero: et naves multas, et praeparavit sibi ligna et aquam.
verses.english: He also took with him an countless multitude of camels, mules, and donkeys. He requisitioned many supply ships, and made sure to prepare wood and water provisions for himself and his army.

verses.latin: Et egressus est ipse, et omnis exercitus ejus, cum equitibus, et cum curribus, et cum sagittariis, et cum balistis, et cum omni apparatu bellico.
verses.english: He himself marched out, and his entire army, fully equipped with cavalry, chariots, archers, catapults, and every kind of war machine.

verses.latin: Et transivit per omnia loca, et per omnem terram, et per omnem regionem, et per omnem gentem, et per omnem populum, et per omnem linguam, et per omnem tribum, et per omnem provinciam, et per omnem civitatem, et per omnem pagum.
verses.english: And he traveled through every place, through every land, every region, every nation, every people, every language group, every tribe, every province, every city, and every village —this is hyperbole to emphasize the extent of his campaign.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Ninive, et transivit Euphraten, et pertransivit Mesopotamiam.
verses.english: He reached the borders of Nineveh, crossed the Euphrates River, and then traversed the entirety of Mesopotamia.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Ciliciae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He came to the borders of Cilicia and marched through all its territories.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Syriam, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He then arrived at the borders of Syria and advanced through all its lands.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Phoenices, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: Next, he reached the borders of Phoenicia and passed through all its regions.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Palaestinae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He proceeded to the borders of Palestine and advanced through all its territories.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Judaeae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He then reached the borders of Judea and marched through all its lands.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Idumaeae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: From there, he arrived at the borders of Idumea and passed through all its regions.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Arabiae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He then came to the borders of Arabia and moved through all its territories.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Aegypti, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: After that, he reached the borders of Egypt and advanced through all its lands.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Libyae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He proceeded to the borders of Libya and marched through all its regions.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Aethiopiae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: From there, he arrived at the borders of Ethiopia and passed through all its territories.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Persidis, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He then reached the borders of Persia and moved through all its lands.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Mediae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: Next, he came to the borders of Media and advanced through all its regions.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Chaldaeorum, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He proceeded to the borders of the Chaldeans and marched through all their territories.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Assyriorum, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He then reached the borders of the Assyrians and passed through all their lands.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Babyloniae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: From there, he arrived at the borders of Babylon and moved through all its regions.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Susianae, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: Next, he came to the borders of Susiana and advanced through all its territories.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Elamitarum, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He proceeded to the borders of the Elamites and marched through all their lands.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Parthorum, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: He then reached the borders of the Parthians and passed through all their regions.

verses.latin: Et venit ad fines Indorum, et transivit per omnes fines ejus.
verses.english: Finally, he arrived at the borders of the Indians and moved through all their territories.

verses.latin: Et factum est cum haec audisset Holofernes exercituum princeps Assyriorum, iratus est valde, et cogitavit conterere omnem terram, sicut locutus fuerat Nabuchodonosor rex Assyriae.
verses.english: It happened that when Holofernes, the chief commander of the Assyrian armies, heard this, he became extremely angry. He then planned to crush all the land—meaning, to utterly destroy all nations—just as Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Assyria, had commanded him.

verses.latin: Et vocavit omnes majores natu, et duces, et praepositos exercitus sui, et in medio eorum communicavit consilium suum.
verses.english: He called all the high-ranking elders, and the military leaders, and the officers of his army. In their presence, he shared his plan with them.

verses.latin: Et dixit quoniam: Confirmavit cor meum ut non parcam omni terrae, et sicut locutus est Nabuchodonosor rex Assyriae, ita et faciam.
verses.english: And he said: "My heart is set. I will not spare any land. Just as Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Assyria, has spoken, so I will do."

verses.latin: Et addidit, et dixit: Ecce noster rex Nabuchodonosor. Praecepit mihi, ut vadam ad omnem terram, et deleam eos qui non sunt subjecti.
verses.english: He added, saying: "Behold, our king, Nebuchadnezzar, has commanded me to go to every land and to wipe out all those who have not submitted to him."

verses.latin: Et tu, Holofernes, qui es princeps exercitus mei, vade, et praecedam te: et ego vadam tecum, et non parcemus populo, qui non est subjectus mihi.
verses.english: He continued to speak, now directly to Holofernes, as if he himself was Nebuchadnezzar: "And you, Holofernes, who are the commander of my army, go ahead, and I will lead the way for you. I will go with you, and we will not spare any people who have not submitted to me."

verses.latin: Et tu praepara tibi exercitum, et collige tibi virum de viris omnibus, qui sunt in exercitu meo.
verses.english: He added, as Nebuchadnezzar instructing Holofernes: "And you, prepare an army for yourself. Gather for yourself men from all the men who are in my army."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes vocavit duces suos, et praepositos exercitus, et numeravit eos qui erant in expeditione:
verses.english: And Holofernes called his commanders and the officers of the army. He counted those who were prepared for the campaign.

verses.latin: Et ascenderunt ad exercitum: et erant centum triginta millia virorum peditum, et duodecim millia virorum equitum, praeter impedimenta et plaustra, quae erant in magna copia.
verses.english: And they assembled the army. There were one hundred thirty thousand infantrymen and twelve thousand cavalrymen, in addition to the baggage and wagons, which were in great abundance, signifying a massive force.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes misit nuntios in omnem terram, qui praeparaverunt ei cibum, et aquam, et ligna, et paleas, et fenum, et omne genus victus.
verses.english: And Holofernes sent messengers into every region he planned to conquer. These messengers made sure that provisions like food, water, wood, straw, hay, and every kind of sustenance were prepared for his army as it advanced.

verses.latin: Ipse autem perambulavit Ciliciam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et pervenit usque ad fines Japheth, et perambulavit universos filios Ophir, et Madiam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et pervenit usque ad terminos Syriae.
verses.english: He himself marched through Cilicia, striking down all who resisted him. He advanced as far as the borders of Japheth—a region possibly referring to northern territories or descendants of Japheth. He then marched through all the sons of Ophir and Media, and he struck down all who resisted him, reaching the borders of Syria.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes perambulavit Syriam Sobal, et omnem Mesopothamiam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et pervenit usque ad terminos Ciliciae.
verses.english: And Holofernes marched through Syria Sobal, and all of Mesopotamia. He struck down all who resisted him, and he arrived at the borders of Cilicia—retracing his steps to consolidate his vast territorial gains.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in Idumaeam, et in Moab, et in filios Ammon: et cepit eos, et vastavit civitates eorum, et pertransivit omnem terram, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et pervenit usque ad terminos Arabum.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into Idumaea, and into Moab, and into the land of the sons of Ammon. He captured them, and he devastated their cities. He passed through all the land, striking down all who resisted him, and he reached as far as the borders of the Arab regions.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in Galilaeam superiorem, et in omnem terram Chanaan, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes came into Upper Galilee and into all the land of Canaan. He struck down all who resisted him, and he seized all their territories, and he established his forces there.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in campum Esdraelon, juxta Dothain, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into the plain of Esdraelon, near Dothan, and he established his forces there—positioning himself strategically in the heart of the land.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnes montes, et pertransivit omnem terram, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et pervenit usque ad terminos Samariae.
verses.english: Holofernes came into all the mountainous regions. He passed through every land, striking down all who resisted him, and reached as far as the borders of Samaria.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram trans Jordanem, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into all the land beyond the Jordan River. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—continuing his relentless expansion.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram trans Libanum, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes also came into all the land beyond Lebanon. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—further extending his dominion.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram maritimam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into all the coastal land. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Philistim, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes also came into all the land of the Philistines. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his campaign of domination continued without pause.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram deserti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the desert land. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—leaving no region unconquered.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aegypti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Egypt. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—demonstrating his overwhelming power.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aethiopiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Ethiopia. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his reach now extending far and wide.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Libiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Libya. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his campaign was total.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram maritimam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into all the coastal land again. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—reinforcing his grip on these crucial areas.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Philistim, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes also came into all the land of the Philistines again. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—confirming his complete conquest.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram deserti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the desert land again. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—leaving no part untouched by his devastation.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aegypti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Egypt again. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his control was absolute.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aethiopiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Ethiopia again. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his dominion was firmly established.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Libiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Libya again. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his destructive path knew no bounds.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram maritimam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into all the coastal land a third time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—the cycle of conquest and re-conquest continued relentlessly.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Philistim, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes also came into all the land of the Philistines a third time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his command was repeatedly enforced.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram deserti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the desert land a third time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his army was an omnipresent threat.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aegypti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Egypt a third time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—each conquest solidifying his brutal reign.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aethiopiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Ethiopia a third time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his authority was felt everywhere.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Libiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Libya a third time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—leaving no doubt about his absolute power.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram maritimam, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes then came into all the coastal land a fourth time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his relentless campaign of subjugation continued.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Philistim, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: Holofernes also came into all the land of the Philistines a fourth time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his domination was total and unyielding.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram deserti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the desert land a fourth time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his presence was felt in every corner of the conquered lands.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aegypti, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Egypt a fourth time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his control over the region was absolute and continually reinforced.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes venit in omnem terram Aethiopiae, et percussit omnes qui sibi restiterant, et cepit omnes terminos eorum, et habitavit in eis.
verses.english: And Holofernes came into all the land of Ethiopia a fourth time. He struck down all who resisted him, and seized all their territories, and established his forces there—his empire was now stretched across a vast and diverse set of regions, all subjected to his will.

verses.latin: Et audierunt filii Israël, qui habitabant in terra Juda, omnia quæ fecerat Holofernes principi nationum, et quemadmodum spoliaverat omnes provincias illorum, et quomodo vastaverat omnes fines eorum :
verses.english: And the children of Israel, who lived in the land of Judea, heard everything that Holofernes had done to the rulers of the nations. They heard how he had plundered all their regions and laid waste to all their territories.

verses.latin: et timuerunt vehementer a facie ejus, et a facie potestatis exercitus ejus, quoniam erat multitudinis nimiae valde, et paratus ad devorandam omnem terram.
verses.english: So they feared him greatly, and they also feared the immense power of his army. It was an exceedingly vast army, prepared to consume and conquer all the land.

verses.latin: Et conturbati sunt valde, et tremuerunt a facie ejus.
verses.english: They were deeply troubled and trembled with fear before him.

verses.latin: Et tenuerunt omnes fines terræ suæ, et occupaverunt omnes in montibus excelsis, et in castellis, et posuerunt munitiones in ipsis.
verses.english: They secured all the borders of their land. They occupied all the high mountains and fortified places, and they set up defenses within them.

verses.latin: Et mundaverunt vestimenta sua, et posuerunt cilicia super se, et prostraverunt se super faciem suam in terram circum templum Dei : et plorabant vociferantes, quod interficeret eos qui sedebant circa altare, et quod tolleret templum suum.
verses.english: They ritually purified their clothing and put on sackcloth as a sign of mourning. They threw themselves face down on the ground all around God's Temple. They cried out loudly, weeping that Holofernes would kill those serving around the altar and seize their Holy Temple.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad omnem terminum Israël nuntios, ut aperirent civitates suas, in occursum faciei Holofernis, ut descenderent ad eos in omni loco suo.
verses.english: And they sent messengers to every border of Israel, telling them to prepare their cities to face Holofernes and to gather together in every stronghold.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt omnes Israël adunanimiter, ad custodiendam vitam suam, et uxorum suarum, et filiorum suorum, et pecudum suorum, et omnium animalium suorum.
verses.english: And all of Israel gathered together with one accord, intending to protect their own lives, as well as the lives of their wives, their children, their livestock, and all their animals.

verses.latin: Et omnis homo fortis, et omnis vir bellator ex Israël, et unusquisque convocatus est in unum.
verses.english: Every man of strength and every warrior from Israel was called together into one unified force.

verses.latin: Et elevaverunt montes excelsos suos, et muniverunt civitates suas.
verses.english: They occupied and strengthened their high mountain positions, and they fortified their cities.

verses.latin: Et mundaverunt vestimenta sua, et posuerunt cilicia super se, et prostraverunt se super faciem suam in terram, et rogaverunt Deum, ut salvet eos.
verses.english: Again, they ritually purified their clothing and put on sackcloth. They threw themselves face down on the ground, and they begged God to save them.

verses.latin: Audientes autem filii Israel, quod Holofernes rex Assyriorum admodum superabat omnem terminum suum, et quoniam veniebat ad illos per viam ad maritimam,
verses.english: When the children of Israel heard that Holofernes, the king of the Assyrians, was greatly expanding his territory and that he was coming towards them by way of the coastal road,

verses.latin: timuerunt vehementer a facie ejus, contemplantes qualia fecerit omnibus regionibus, quæ propinquæ erant.
verses.english: they were extremely afraid of him, considering all that he had done to the regions that were near them.

verses.latin: Et perturbati sunt vehementer a facie multitudinis nimiae, quia non erat eis facultas obsistere illis.
verses.english: They were also greatly alarmed by the sheer size of his army, because they had no way to resist them.

verses.latin: Et senuerunt filii Israel, et clamaverunt ad Dominum Deum suum cum magna instantia, et humiliaverunt animas suas in jejuniis et orationibus, ipsi, et mulieres eorum.
verses.english: The people of Israel grew weary with fear, and they cried out to the Lord their God with great urgency. Both the men and their wives humbled themselves with fasting and prayers.

verses.latin: Et sacerdotes induerunt se ciliciis, et posuerunt cinerem super capita sua in medio Israel, et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum omni instantia ut visitaret plebem suam Israel.
verses.english: The priests dressed themselves in sackcloth and placed ashes on their heads in the midst of Israel. They cried out to the Lord with all urgency that He would protect His people Israel.

verses.latin: Et nuntiavit Ozias Joakim summo sacerdoti, et universis senioribus civitatum suarum, ut colligerentur omnes in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Ozias announced to Joakim, the high priest, and to all the elders of their cities, that everyone should gather in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et scripserunt ad omnes habitantes Israelem, quae erant in Samaria in montanis, et eas quae erant trans Jordanem, ut festinarent omnes, et traderent vias occupationi, quas Holofernes pervenerat.
verses.english: They wrote to all the inhabitants of Israel who were in Samaria, in the mountainous regions, and those who were beyond the Jordan. They ordered that everyone should hurry and prepare the roads for defense, the very roads Holofernes had approached.

verses.latin: Et munierunt omnia juga montium excelsorum, quibus facilis transitus esse poterat, et castella posuerunt in villis.
verses.english: They fortified all the high mountain passes through which an enemy could easily pass, and they placed garrisons in the towns.

verses.latin: Et repleverunt loca sua in summitatibus montium, et munierunt ea inter se, et posuerunt exercitum suum ad custodiam itinerum.
verses.english: They took their positions on the tops of the mountains and fortified them, placing their army to guard the routes.

verses.latin: Et factus est sensus coram Holoferne, secundum litteras Joakim, quod filii Israel præparaverunt se ad pugnam, et concluserant transitum montium.
verses.english: And word came to Holofernes, according to reports that involved Joakim, that the children of Israel had prepared themselves for battle and had blocked the mountain passes.

verses.latin: Et inflammatus est iracundia Holofernes vehementer, et vocavit omnes principes Moab, et duces Ammon, et omnes præfectos maritimæ.
verses.english: Holofernes was greatly inflamed with anger. He called all the princes of Moab, the leaders of Ammon, and all the prefects of the coastal region to him.

verses.latin: Et dixit illis: Nuntiate mihi, filii Chanaan, quis est hic populus, qui montibus sedet, aut quæ sunt civitates eorum, et quæ est multitudo exercitus illorum, et in quo sita est virtus eorum, vel quid est illud, quod resistunt mihi, et nolunt occurrere in occursum meum.
verses.english: He said to them, 'Tell me, sons of Canaan, who are these people who dwell in the mountains? What are their cities like? How large is their army, and what is the source of their strength? Why do they resist me and refuse to surrender to me?'

verses.latin: Et respondit Achior dux omnium filiorum Ammon, dicens: Audi, domine, verbum ex ore servi tui, et narrabo tibi veritatem de populo hoc, qui in montibus habitat, juxta quod est dictum de filiis Israel.
verses.english: Achior, the leader of all the sons of Ammon, answered and said, 'Hear, O lord, a word from your servant. I will tell you the truth about this people who live in the mountains, according to what is known about the children of Israel.'

verses.latin: Populus iste oriundus est de Chaldæis.
verses.english: This people originated from the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Conseditque prius in Mesopotamia, et noluit sequi deos patrios, qui erant in terra Chaldæorum.
verses.english: They settled first in Mesopotamia but refused to follow the ancestral gods who were worshipped in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Et descenderunt de viis eorum, et adoraverunt Deum cæli, Deum quem cognoverant.
verses.english: They departed from their idolatrous ways and worshipped the God of the universe, the true God whom they had come to know.

verses.latin: Et ejecerunt illos a facie deorum suorum, et fugerunt in Mesopotamiam, et habitaverunt illic dies multos.
verses.english: The Chaldeans then drove them away from their gods, so they fled into Mesopotamia and lived there for many days.

verses.latin: Et inde migraverunt, et venerunt in terra Chanaan, et multiplicati sunt, et facti sunt nimis potentes auri et argenti, et multitudinis pecorum.
verses.english: From there, they migrated and came into the land of Canaan. There, they multiplied greatly and became very powerful, possessing much gold, silver, and vast herds of livestock.

verses.latin: Et descenderunt in Ægyptum, et facti sunt multitudinis nimiae, ut nemo dinumerare posset genus eorum.
verses.english: Then they went down into Egypt and became such an immense multitude that no one could count their descendants.

verses.latin: Et afflixerunt eos Ægyptii in opere luti et latere, et humiliaverunt illos, et facti sunt servi.
verses.english: The Egyptians afflicted them with forced labor in clay and brick-making, humiliating them until they became slaves.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Deum suum, et percussit terram Ægypti divinis signis, et elevaverunt illos de medio eorum.
verses.english: They cried out to their God, and He struck the land of Egypt with miraculous signs, bringing them out from among the Egyptians.

verses.latin: Et secuerunt mare Rubrum, et deduxit illos in viam deserti Sinæ, et dederunt illis ad omnem abundantiam.
verses.english: God parted the Red Sea for them, and He led them through the desert of Sinai, providing for all their needs abundantly.

verses.latin: Et habitaverunt in terra Chanaan, et sedit super eos in ædificatione civitatum, et plantaverunt arbores, et omnes populi de montibus sunt eradicati.
verses.english: They lived in the land of Canaan, where God established them as they built cities and planted trees. All the peoples from the mountains were rooted out before them.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt nimis potentes auri et argenti, et multitudinis pecorum, ut non posset numerari multitudo eorum.
verses.english: They became exceedingly powerful in gold and silver, and in their vast herds of livestock, so that their multitude could not be counted.

verses.latin: Et peccaverunt in Deum suum, et fecerunt idola, et propter hoc projecti sunt de terra sua, et dispersi sunt per omnem terram.
verses.english: But they sinned against their God and made idols. Because of this, they were cast out from their land and scattered throughout every land.

verses.latin: Et quando non peccaverunt coram Deo suo, erat Deus eorum propitius illis, quia odio habet iniquitatem.
verses.english: When they did not sin before their God, their God was merciful to them, because He hates iniquity.

verses.latin: Et quando declinaverunt a via sua, quam dederat illis, ut ambularent in ea, exterminati sunt in bello a multis gentibus, et traducti sunt in terram non suam.
verses.english: But when they turned aside from the way He had given them to walk in, they were destroyed in war by many nations and led away into lands that were not their own.

verses.latin: Et nunc a Deo suo conversi sunt, et de deserto, in quo erant fames, et sitis, et multitudo hostium, et exspoliaverunt omnem gentem in manu eorum.
verses.english: And now they have returned to their God, even after enduring hunger, thirst, and many enemies in the desert. Because they returned to Him, they have plundered every nation that fell into their hands.

verses.latin: Et in omni loco, quo erant filii Israel, Deus eorum salvavit eos, et præparavit eis loca in montibus, et sedit in eis.
verses.english: In every place where the children of Israel were, their God saved them. He prepared places for them in the mountains and established them there.

verses.latin: Et nunc ergo, domine mi rex, si est aliqua iniquitas in populo isto, et peccant in Deum suum, sciamus, et ascendamus ad eos, et debellabimus eos.
verses.english: And now, therefore, my lord king, if there is any iniquity in this people, and they are sinning against their God, let us discover it. Then we can go up against them and conquer them.

verses.latin: Si autem non est offensio in gente hac, suadeo tibi ut abstineas te ab eis, ne forte defendat illos Dominus eorum, et sis in opprobrium omni terræ.
verses.english: But if there is no offense in this nation, I advise you to keep away from them, lest their Lord perhaps defend them and you become a disgrace to all the earth.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum cessasset Achior, et hæc verba finisset, murmuravit omnis populus in circuitu castrorum.
verses.english: When Achior finished speaking these words, all the people around the camps murmured.

verses.latin: Et principes Holofernis, et omnes ministri ejus, et duces Moabitarum, in Circuitu, et Ammonitæ, irascebantur de verbis Achior.
verses.english: Holofernes' princes and all his ministers, as well as the nearby leaders of the Moabites and Ammonites, were enraged by Achior's words.

verses.latin: Et dicentes: Non ergo poterimus percutere filios Israel, quia fortis est virtus eorum, et in auxilio est illis Deus eorum?
verses.english: They said, 'Shall we then be unable to strike the children of Israel because their strength is great and their God helps them?'

verses.latin: Et dixit Holofernes: Quis est Deus, præter Nabuchodonosor? Ipse dominus et rex, et Deus omnis terræ, et ipse percutiet illos in manu mea.
verses.english: Holofernes said, 'Who is God besides Nabuchodonosor? He alone is lord and king, and God of all the earth! He himself will strike them down through my hand.'

verses.latin: Et traduxerunt Achior de castris, et duxerunt eum usque ad montes, et alligaverunt illum ad arborem, et dimiserunt eum.
verses.english: They led Achior out of the camps and took him as far as the mountains, where they tied him to a tree and left him.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt in castra sua.
verses.english: Then they returned to their own camps.

verses.latin: Et tulerunt filii Israel Achior, et adduxerunt eum ad Oziam, et ad principes civitatis, et sedit in medio eorum.
verses.english: The children of Israel took Achior and brought him to Ozias and the leaders of the city, and he sat in their midst.

verses.latin: Et narravit illis omnia, quæ locutus est Holofernes, et omnia verba, quæ dixerat omnis populus, et qualia minatus erat Holofernes in Israel.
verses.english: He recounted to them everything that Holofernes had spoken, and all the words that the people had said, and the threats Holofernes had made against Israel.

verses.latin: Et populus prostraverunt se in terram, et adoraverunt Deum, et clamaverunt in Domino, dicentes:
verses.english: The people prostrated themselves on the ground, worshipped God, and cried out to the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Audientes autem filii Israël qui habitabant in terra Juda, quæcumque fecerat Holofernes principi nationum, et quemadmodum diripuerat omnes sanctas eorum, timuerunt valde a facie illius.
verses.english: But the children of Israel, who were living in the land of Judea, heard about all the things Holofernes had done to the chiefs of the nations and how he had plundered all their holy places. They were greatly terrified of him.

verses.latin: Et conturbati sunt nimis a facie Holofernis, et pro civitate Jerusalem, et pro templo Domini Dei sui.
verses.english: They were extremely agitated because of Holofernes, and because of what could happen to the city of Jerusalem, and to the Temple of the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Erat enim recentissimè reversio eorum ab interfectione, et nuper omnis populus Juda congregatus de captivitate Jerusalem.
verses.english: For they had only very recently returned from a great slaughter, and all the people of Judea had just been gathered back from the captivity that devastated Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et recens erat omnis populus super faciem terræ Judææ, et instaurata sunt vasa, et altare, et ædes a contaminatione.
verses.english: And all the people were still new to the land of Judea, and their sacred vessels, the altar, and the Temple itself had only just been restored from their defilement.

verses.latin: Et miserunt in omnem fines Samariæ, et per Cœle Syriæ, et Galilee, in Caman, et in Cades, et ad fluvium Æsion, et ad valles Salem.
verses.english: So they sent messages throughout all the borders of Samaria, and through Coele-Syria and Galilee, to Kaman and to Kadesh, and to the river Aision, and to the valleys of Salem.

verses.latin: Et cœperunt præoccupare omnes vertices montium excelsorum, et munierunt in ipsis castella, et collegerunt cibaria in præparationem belli.
verses.english: And they began to seize all the tops of the highest mountains, and they fortified these with strongholds, and they gathered provisions in preparation for war.

verses.latin: Et Joakim sacerdos magnus scripsit ad eos qui erant Bethulæ, et Betomesthaim, quæ est contra Esdrelon juxta campum magnum, ad faciem.
verses.english: And Joakim, the high priest, wrote to those who were in Bethulia and Betomesthaim, which is opposite Esdraelon, near the great plain, facing it.

verses.latin: Per quem daretur illis exitus, ad Judæam pertransire, et aditum præcluderent, ut illi pertransire non possent.
verses.english: Through this place, an exit could be provided for the enemy to pass through to Judea, so they should cut off access there, preventing the enemy from passing through.

verses.latin: Erat enim difficilis aditus ad Judæam, et angustus, quasi per bivirum, ut non amplius quam singuli, aut bini simul ire possent.
verses.english: For the approach to Judea was difficult and narrow, almost like a path for only two people, so that no more than one, or at most two, could pass through at the same time.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt filii Israël ad Dominum Deum suum cum instantia magna, et humiliaverunt animas suas in jejuniis multis.
verses.english: And the children of Israel cried out to the Lord their God with great urgency, and they humbled their souls with much fasting.

verses.latin: Et sacerdotes, et Levitae, et omnes qui morabantur in Jerusalem, succinxerunt se ciliciis, et prostraverunt se ante faciem Domini, et imposuerunt cinerem capitibus suis.
verses.english: And the priests, and the Levites, and all who were living in Jerusalem, girded themselves with sackcloth, and prostrated themselves before the Lord, and put ashes on their heads.

verses.latin: Et vestierunt sacerdotes altare ciliciis, et offerebant hostias Domino, et vota Domini.
verses.english: And the priests covered the altar with sackcloth, and they offered sacrifices to the Lord, and also made solemn vows to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et clamabant ad Dominum Deum Israël, ut non daret in prædam eorum qui volebant disperdere eos, et deponentes hæreditatem ipsorum.
verses.english: And they cried out to the Lord God of Israel, asking that He would not deliver them as prey to those who wanted to destroy them and to cast down their inheritance—the land and the covenant given to them.

verses.latin: Et exaudivit Dominus vocem eorum, et respexit afflictionem eorum.
verses.english: And the Lord heard their voice, and He looked upon their affliction.

verses.latin: Et cœpit omnis populus Judææ, et qui habitabant in Jerusalem, prostrati ante faciem templi, supplices orare Dominum, et super capita eorum cinerem spargere.
verses.english: And all the people of Judea, and those who lived in Jerusalem, began to prostrate themselves before the Temple, to pray humbly to the Lord, and to sprinkle ashes on their heads.

verses.latin: Et vestiti ciliciis, clamabant ad Dominum cum omni virtute sua, ut visitaret cum bonitate populum suum Israël.
verses.english: And dressed in sackcloth, they cried out to the Lord with all their might, that He would visit His people Israel with goodness and salvation.

verses.latin: Et ut prosterneret exercitum eorum in conspectu eorum qui eos ad vexationem provocabant.
verses.english: And that He would overthrow the enemy's army in the sight of those who were provoking them to such torment.

verses.latin: Et ut dissiparet exercitum potentiae Holofernis, qui eos volebat interficere.
verses.english: And that He would scatter the powerful army of Holofernes, which wanted to kill them.

verses.latin: Et post biduum abstinuerunt se omnes filii Israël de omnibus fructibus terræ.
verses.english: And after two days, all the children of Israel abstained from all the produce of the land.

verses.latin: Et Joakim sacerdos magnus, et omnes sacerdotes qui steterant in conspectu Domini, et ministrabant Domino, hortati sunt omnes Israël ad vigilandum, et deprecandum Dominum.
verses.english: And Joakim the high priest, and all the priests who stood before the Lord and ministered to the Lord, exhorted all Israel to keep watch and to pray humbly to the Lord.

verses.latin: Memores quia sicut factum est patribus eorum in bello adversus Ægyptios, quemadmodum prostrati sunt omnes.
verses.english: Remembering that just as it happened to their fathers in the war against the Egyptians, how all their enemies were overthrown.

verses.latin: Ita orantes Dominum suum, et quærentes pacem et misericordiam ab eo.
verses.english: So, praying to their Lord, they sought peace and mercy from Him.

verses.latin: Itaque omnes filii Israël in terra Judæa, et qui habitabant in Jerusalem, jejunaverunt triginta dies ante faciem Domini, et orabant sine intermissione.
verses.english: Therefore, all the children of Israel in the land of Judea, and those who lived in Jerusalem, fasted for thirty days before the Lord, and prayed without ceasing.

verses.latin: Et Joakim sacerdos magnus, et omnes sacerdotes qui steterant in conspectu Domini, et ministrabant Domino, hortati sunt omnes Israël ad vigilandum, et deprecandum Dominum.
verses.english: And Joakim the high priest, and all the priests who stood before the Lord and ministered to the Lord, exhorted all Israel to keep watch and to pray humbly to the Lord.

verses.latin: Memores quia sicut factum est patribus eorum in bello adversus Ægyptios, quemadmodum prostrati sunt omnes.
verses.english: Remembering that just as it happened to their fathers in the war against the Egyptians, how all their enemies were overthrown.

verses.latin: Ita orantes Dominum suum, et quærentes pacem et misericordiam ab eo.
verses.english: So, praying to their Lord, they sought peace and mercy from Him.

verses.latin: Et sicut jejunaverunt patres nostri in deserto, sicut Moyses jejunavit quadraginta dies et noctes, ita et nos jejunemus in hoc bello.
verses.english: And just as our fathers fasted in the desert, and just as Moses fasted for forty days and nights, so also let us fast in this war.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt in monte Sion bellum in conspectu Domini, et in civitate Jerusalem bellum in conspectu Domini.
verses.english: And they placed the war on Mount Zion before the Lord, and the war in the city of Jerusalem before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et Joakim sacerdos magnus dixit ad eos qui erant in Bethulia, et Betomesthaim, ut non darent exitum hostibus.
verses.english: And Joakim the high priest said to those who were in Bethulia and Betomesthaim, that they should not give the enemies an exit.

verses.latin: Et ut obsiderent montem, et vallaretur civitas munitionibus.
verses.english: And that they should hold the mountain under siege, and that the city should be fortified with strong defenses.

verses.latin: Et misit litteras in omnem fines Samariæ, et per Cœle Syriæ, et Galilee, in Caman, et in Cades, et ad fluvium Æsion, et ad valles Salem.
verses.english: So they sent messages throughout all the borders of Samaria, and through Coele-Syria and Galilee, to Kaman and to Kadesh, and to the river Aision, and to the valleys of Salem.

verses.latin: Et omnes qui erant in locis his, audientes verbum sacerdotis magni, et præpositi, timuerunt valde a facie Holofernis, et convenerunt omnes ad unum in auxilium fratrum suorum.
verses.english: And all who were in these places, hearing the word of the high priest and the prefect, feared Holofernes greatly, and all gathered together as one to help their brothers.

verses.latin: Et in omnibus civitatibus suis, et in omnibus finibus suis, constituerunt bellum, et muniverunt civitates suas.
verses.english: And in all their cities, and in all their borders, they prepared for war and fortified their cities.

verses.latin: Et miserunt in omnem fines Samariæ, et per Cœle Syriæ, et Galilee, in Caman, et in Cades, et ad fluvium Æsion, et ad valles Salem, ut obsiderent montem, et vallaretur civitas munitionibus.
verses.english: And they sent messages throughout all the borders of Samaria, and through Coele-Syria and Galilee, to Kaman and to Kadesh, and to the river Aision, and to the valleys of Salem, telling them to hold the mountain under siege, and that the city should be fortified with strong defenses.

verses.latin: Et omnis populus Judææ, et qui habitabant in Jerusalem, jejunaverunt triginta dies ante faciem Domini, et orabant sine intermissione.
verses.english: Therefore, all the children of Israel in the land of Judea, and those who lived in Jerusalem, fasted for thirty days before the Lord, and prayed without ceasing.

verses.latin: Et Joakim sacerdos magnus, et omnes sacerdotes qui steterant in conspectu Domini, et ministrabant Domino, hortati sunt omnes Israël ad vigilandum, et deprecandum Dominum.
verses.english: And Joakim the high priest, and all the priests who stood before the Lord and ministered to the Lord, exhorted all Israel to keep watch and to pray humbly to the Lord.

verses.latin: Memores quia sicut factum est patribus eorum in bello adversus Ægyptios, quemadmodum prostrati sunt omnes.
verses.english: Remembering that just as it happened to their fathers in the war against the Egyptians, how all their enemies were overthrown.

verses.latin: Ita orantes Dominum suum, et quærentes pacem et misericordiam ab eo.
verses.english: So, praying to their Lord, they sought peace and mercy from Him.

verses.latin: Et sicut jejunaverunt patres nostri in deserto, sicut Moyses jejunavit quadraginta dies et noctes, ita et nos jejunemus in hoc bello.
verses.english: And just as our fathers fasted in the desert, and just as Moses fasted for forty days and nights, so also let us fast in this war.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt in monte Sion bellum in conspectu Domini, et in civitate Jerusalem bellum in conspectu Domini.
verses.english: And they placed the war on Mount Zion before the Lord, and the war in the city of Jerusalem before the Lord.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est Holoferni principi militiæ Assyriorum, quod filii Israël pararent se ad pugnam, et conclusissent iter montanum: et præoccupassent omnem verticem montis excelsi: et posuissent illic custodias.
verses.english: It was reported to Holofernes, the commander of the Assyrian army, that the children of Israel were preparing themselves for battle and had closed off the mountain passes. They had also taken control of every high mountain peak and placed guards there.

verses.latin: Et iratus est in iracundia sua supra modum: et convocavit omnes principes Moab, et duces Ammon, et omnes præfectos maritimas regionis.
verses.english: Holofernes became extremely angry. He called together all the princes of Moab, the leaders of Ammon, and all the governors from the coastal regions.

verses.latin: Et dixit illis: Dicite mihi, quæ est gens ista quæ sedet in montibus, aut quæ est civitas aut quæ sunt urbes ipsorum, et quanta est virtus eorum? quæ est illorum excellentia, quoniam hi mihi minimam habuerunt resistentiam, et non sunt egressi obviam mihi?
verses.english: He said to them: 'Tell me, what kind of people are these who live in the mountains? What is their city, or what are their cities? How strong are they? What is their excellence, given that they have offered me so little resistance and have not come out to meet me?'

verses.latin: Tunc Achior dux omnium filiorum Ammon, respondens ait: Si digneris domine, audire, loquar in conspectu tuo veritatem de populo hoc qui in montibus habitat, et non egredietur ex ore meo mendacium.
verses.english: Then Achior, the leader of all the children of Ammon, replied and said: 'If you would be pleased to listen, my lord, I will speak the truth in your presence about these people who live in the mountains, and no lie will come out of my mouth.'

verses.latin: Populus iste ex progenie Chaldæorum est.
verses.english: These people are descendants of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Consedit primum in Mesopotamia, quoniam noluerunt sequi deos patrum suorum, qui erant in terra Chaldæorum.
verses.english: They first settled in Mesopotamia, because they refused to follow the gods of their ancestors, who were worshipped in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Et declinaverunt de via eorum, et multitudine simulacrorum servierunt,
verses.english: They turned away from the ways of their fathers and served a multitude of idols.

verses.latin: et ideo surrexit ira Dei eorum super eos: et expulsi sunt de sedibus suis, et in regionem Mesopotamiæ commigraverunt, et habitaverunt illic per multa tempora.
verses.english: And because of this, the anger of their God rose against them. They were driven out of their homeland and migrated to the region of Mesopotamia, where they lived for a long time.

verses.latin: Et dixit illis Deus eorum, ut egrederentur de habitatione sua, et irent in terram Chanaan: et illic consederunt, et locupletati sunt valde in auro et argento, et in multitudine nimia pecorum.
verses.english: Their God told them to leave their dwelling place and go into the land of Canaan. They settled there and became extremely wealthy in gold, silver, and vast numbers of livestock.

verses.latin: Et descenderunt in Ægyptum: et commorati sunt ibi per annos quadringentos, in tantum ut multiplicaretur eorum progenies.
verses.english: Then they went down into Egypt and lived there for four hundred years, so much so that their descendants multiplied greatly.

verses.latin: Et cum dominaretur illis rex Ægypti, et opprimeret eos in ædificationibus civitatum et latere et luto: clamaverunt ad Dominum suum, et percussit omnem terram Ægypti plagis variis.
verses.english: But when the king of Egypt dominated them and oppressed them with forced labor, building cities with bricks and clay, they cried out to their Lord. Their Lord then struck the entire land of Egypt with various plagues.

verses.latin: Et ejecit illos Deus de terra Ægypti: et fecit mirabilia in ipsis.
verses.english: Their God then led them out of the land of Egypt and performed wonders for them.

verses.latin: Et divisit mare Rubrum in duodecim partes: et transduxit illos per siccum, et submersit in illo omnes insequentes eos cum multitudine exercitus eorum.
verses.english: He divided the Red Sea into twelve parts and led them across on dry ground. He drowned all those who pursued them, along with their great army, in that same sea.

verses.latin: Et acceperunt terram Idumææ, et omnium filiorum Moab: et habitaverunt in ea, venientes in Chanaan.
verses.english: They took the land of Edom and of all the children of Moab, and they lived in it, as they came into Canaan.

verses.latin: Et ejecerunt omnes habitatores terræ montanæ.
verses.english: They drove out all the inhabitants of the mountainous land.

verses.latin: Et habitaverunt in regionibus eorum, et magnificati sunt in montibus Idumææ, et Syriæ, et illuc consederunt.
verses.english: They lived in the regions of these lands and became powerful in the mountains of Edom and Syria. They settled there.

verses.latin: Et quotienscumque non peccaverunt in conspectu Dei sui, erant cum illis bona: Deus enim illorum odit iniquitatem.
verses.english: As often as they did not sin in the sight of their God, good things were with them. For their God hates iniquity.

verses.latin: Et postquam recesserunt a via quam dederat illis, exterminati sunt in bellis a multis nationibus: et multi ex eis captivi abducti sunt in terram non suam.
verses.english: But after they turned away from the path that their God had given them, they were destroyed in wars by many nations. Many of them were led away captive into lands that were not their own.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt templum Dei illorum in humilitate, et sedes eorum in terra, et cæleste sacrificium eorum in desolatione.
verses.english: The temple of their God was brought low, their dwelling places on earth were destroyed, and their heavenly sacrifice—the sacrifices they offered to God—was laid waste.

verses.latin: Et cum reversi essent ad Dominum Deum suum, ascendentes de captivitate in qua dispersi fuerant, et possedissent Jerusalem, ubi Sanctuarium ipsorum est, et consedissent in montibus, quoniam montes erant desolati:
verses.english: But when they returned to their Lord God, coming up from the captivity where they had been scattered, and took possession of Jerusalem—where their Sanctuary is—and settled in the mountains, because the mountains had been desolate:

verses.latin: hæc nunc, domine mi rex, et de servo tuo sciscitari digneris, si est iniquitas eorum in conspectu Dei sui, ascendamus ad illos: quoniam potest illos Deus eorum tradere tibi, et subiicientur sub jugo potestatis tuæ.
verses.english: Now, my lord the king, if you would be pleased to inquire of your servant, if there is any iniquity among them in the sight of their God, let us go up to them. For then their God can deliver them to you, and they will be brought under the yoke of your power.

verses.latin: Si autem non est offensa populi hujus in conspectu Dei sui, non poterimus resistere illis, quoniam Deus eorum defendet illos: et erimus in opprobrium universæ terræ.
verses.english: However, if there is no offense committed by these people in the sight of their God, we will not be able to resist them. For their God will defend them, and we will become a disgrace to the entire world.

verses.latin: Et factum est: cum hæc verba cessassent Achior, quæ loquutus est, omnes principes Holofernis irati sunt valde: et cogitaverunt interficere eum, dicentes:
verses.english: And it came to pass: when these words that Achior had spoken ceased, all the princes of Holofernes became very angry. They planned to kill him, saying:

verses.latin: Quis est iste, ut dicat filiis Israël, quia Deus eorum defendat illos? quasi vere sint dæmoniorum fortitudo.
verses.english: 'Who is this man, to say to the children of Israel that their God will defend them? As if they truly have the strength of demons!'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, Holofernes princeps militiæ, quia verba ejus vera sunt, apprehendamus eum, et mittamus eum in civitatem Bethulia, et videamus cum aliis interfici.
verses.english: Now then, Holofernes, commander of the army, because his words are true, let us seize him and send him into the city of Bethulia. Then we will see him killed along with the others.

verses.latin: Ut cum capta fuerit civitas, tunc et de manu nostra transeat: et tunc sciet, quoniam quasi Deus noster potens est Holofernes, et terra nostra vindicabit se in spiculis eorum.
verses.english: So that when the city is captured, he too will perish by our hand. Then he will know that Holofernes is as powerful as our god, and our land will take revenge with their spears.

verses.latin: Et dixit Holofernes ad Achior: Quoniam prophetasti, dicens, quod gens Israël a Deo suo defendatur, ut ostendas quia non est Deus, nisi Nabuchodonosor: cum occiderimus omnes quasi unum hominem, tunc et tu cum illis interibis gladio Assyriorum, et omnem gentem Israël simul perdes.
verses.english: Holofernes then said to Achior: 'Because you have prophesied, saying that the nation of Israel is defended by their God, you are to show that there is no God except Nebuchadnezzar: when we have killed all of them as if they were one man, then you too will perish with them by the sword of the Assyrians, and you will be completely destroyed along with the entire nation of Israel.'

verses.latin: Et ostendam tibi quia Nabuchodonosor est dominus universæ terræ: et præter illum non est alius.
verses.english: And I will show you that Nebuchadnezzar is the lord of the entire earth, and there is no other besides him.

verses.latin: Et cum reversus fueris, et inventus fueris interfectus cum illis, cognosces quia deus est, qui misit te contra nos in omni regione nostra.
verses.english: When you return, and are found dead among them, you will acknowledge that the god who sent you against us is indeed present in all our region.

verses.latin: Et ipsi cum acceperint te, ducent te ad montem Bethuliæ, et ponent te in vertice.
verses.english: And they themselves, when they have taken you, will lead you to the mountain of Bethulia and place you on its summit.

verses.latin: Et si confundantur in eo qui in montibus est, aut si non est ibi quod credas illis, non inveniet te sicut mortuum, et tunc reddemus tibi ut in his qui non est interfectus.
verses.english: And if they are put to shame by the one who is in the mountains, or if there is nothing there that you believe in them, he will not find you as dead, and then we will restore you as one who is not slain.

verses.latin: Sed si Deus eorum non est fortitudo eorum, sicut tu existimas, tunc dabit te in manum nostram, et omnem gentem Israël interficere, et ego faciam, ut tu moriaris, et non invenies te in medio illorum, et tunc reddemus tibi ut in his qui non est interfectus.
verses.english: But if their God is not their strength, as you suppose, then he will deliver you into our hands, and we will kill the entire nation of Israel. I will make sure you die, and you will not find yourself among them. Then we will deal with you as one who has not been slain.

verses.latin: Et ipse non vult, ut non moriaris, sed ego te ipsum interficiam.
verses.english: And he [your God] does not wish for you to avoid death; rather, I myself will kill you.

verses.latin: Et ergo accipe eum, et duc eum ad montem Bethuliæ, et ponite eum in vertice, et relinquite eum ibi.
verses.english: Therefore, take him, lead him to the mountain of Bethulia, place him on its summit, and leave him there.

verses.latin: Et assumptis Achior, exierunt de castris, et venerunt ad montem Bethuliæ, et posuerunt eum in vertice.
verses.english: So they took Achior, went out from the camp, came to the mountain of Bethulia, and placed him on its summit.

verses.latin: Et ecce, filii Israël in vertice montis, et videntes eum, descenderunt ad eum.
verses.english: And behold, the children of Israel were on the summit of the mountain, and seeing him, they came down to him.

verses.latin: Et assumpserunt eum, et duxerunt eum in Bethuliam, et posuerunt eum in medio illorum.
verses.english: They took him and led him into Bethulia and placed him in their midst.

verses.latin: Et narrat eis omnia, quæ facta sunt ei ab Holoferne, et quomodo populus ejus cogitaverat interficere eum.
verses.english: And he recounted to them everything that had happened to him from Holofernes, and how Holofernes' people had planned to kill him.

verses.latin: Et quomodo ipse dixerat de populo suo, et quomodo Holofernes locutus est de eo, et quomodo decreverat interficere eum.
verses.english: He told them how he himself had spoken about his own people, and how Holofernes had spoken about him, and how he had decided to kill him.

verses.latin: Et omnes filii Israël audientes verba Achior, timuerunt valde, et prostraverunt se super terram, et adoraverunt Deum, et dixerunt:
verses.english: And all the children of Israel, hearing the words of Achior, were greatly afraid. They prostrated themselves on the ground and worshipped God, and said:
