verses.latin: Et nuntiatum est Holoferni, principi militiæ Assyriorum, quoniam filii Israël præparassent se ad pugnam, et conclusissent iter montanum.
verses.english: It was reported to Holofernes, the general of the Assyrian army, that the children of Israel had prepared themselves for battle and had blocked the mountain pass.

verses.latin: Et iratus est Holofernes nimis, et convocavit omnes principes Moab, et duces Ammon, et universos duces maritimæ regionis.
verses.english: Holofernes became extremely angry. He then summoned all the leaders of Moab, the commanders of Ammon, and all the chieftains of the coastal region.

verses.latin: Dixitque eis: Nuntiate mihi, filii Chanaan, quis est populus iste, qui sedet in montibus, vel quæ est civitas aut patriæ illorum, et quæ est virtus eorum, vel quæ est multitudo eorum?
verses.english: He said to them: "Tell me, people of Canaan, who are these people living in the mountains? What is their city, or what is their country? What is their strength, and how numerous are they?"

verses.latin: quis est dux militiæ eorum? et quare isti soli spernunt venire obviam mihi præ omnibus qui habitant in orientali plaga?
verses.english: Who is the commander of their army? And why do these people alone refuse to come and meet me, when all who live in the eastern regions have submitted?

verses.latin: Tunc Achior dux omnium filiorum Ammon, respondens ait: Audi, princeps, verbum ex ore servi tui, et loquar veritatem in conspectu tuo: quoniam non egredietur mendacium ex ore meo in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: Then Achior, the leader of all the people of Ammon, replied: "Listen, General, to what your servant has to say. I will speak the truth in your presence, for no lie will come from my mouth before you."

verses.latin: Populus iste ex stirpe Chaldæorum est.
verses.english: These people are descendants of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Consederunt prius in Mesopotamia, eo quod noluerunt sequi deos patrum suorum, qui erant in terra Chaldæorum.
verses.english: They first settled in Mesopotamia because they refused to follow the gods of their ancestors, who were worshipped in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Et declinaverunt de via parentum suorum, et adoraverunt Deum cæli, Deum quem cognoverunt: et ejecerunt eos a facie deorum suorum: et fugerunt in Mesopotamiam, et habitaverunt illic dies multos.
verses.english: They deviated from the path of their parents and worshipped the God of the sky, the God whom they came to know. Their own gods then rejected them, so they fled into Mesopotamia and lived there for many days.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis Deus eorum, ut exirent de habitatione sua, et irent in terram Chanaan. In hac autem commanserunt, et ditati sunt in auro et argento, et in multo nimis pecore.
verses.english: Then their God told them to leave their dwelling place and go into the land of Canaan. They remained in that land, becoming rich in gold and silver, and possessing a very large amount of livestock.

verses.latin: Inde descenderunt in Ægyptum, et habitaverunt ibi, donec impleta sunt tempora famis de terra Chanaan: et multiplicati sunt, et facti sunt ibi magni, in tantum ut innumerabilis esset multitudo eorum.
verses.english: From there, they went down into Egypt and lived there until the famine in the land of Canaan ended. They multiplied and became a great people there, so much so that their multitude was countless.

verses.latin: Unde resistentes eis rex Ægypti, in humiliatu eos in luto et latere, et fecit illos sibi servos.
verses.english: Because of this, the king of Egypt resisted them. He humiliated them by making them work with mud and bricks, and he made them his slaves.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Deum suum: et percussit terram Ægypti sanitatibus variis.
verses.english: They cried out to their God, and He struck the land of Egypt with various plagues.

verses.latin: Cumque ejecissent illos Ægyptii a facie sua, et fugissent plagam Dei, et vellent persequi eos, et reducere ad suos fines,
verses.english: When the Egyptians had driven them out, and they had fled the plague sent by God, the Egyptians wanted to pursue them and bring them back to their own territories.

verses.latin: clamavit Deus cæli, et siccaverunt aquæ. Et pertransierunt mare Rubrum, usque ad iter deserti: et deseruerunt omnes terminos.
verses.english: Then the God of the sky cried out, and the waters dried up. They crossed the Red Sea on their journey into the desert, abandoning all their former boundaries.

verses.latin: Habitaveruntque in desertis montis Sinai, et commiserunt multas contentiones adversus Deum cæli.
verses.english: They lived in the deserts of Mount Sinai, and they caused many disputes against the God of the sky.

verses.latin: Et cum irasceretur eis Deus omnis terræ, jussit eos ire in regionem Amorrhæorum, et omnes Chananæos, Pherezæos, et Hethæos, et Hievæos, et Jebusæos, qui erant in deserto per annos multos.
verses.english: And when the God of all the earth became angry with them, He commanded them to go into the region of the Amorites, and all the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hittites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who had been in the desert for many years.

verses.latin: Et habitabant illic annis multis, dum irasceretur Deus in eos.
verses.english: And they lived there for many years while God remained angry with them.

verses.latin: Et post hæc, cum commovissent eos, et fugissent ab eo, et recessissent de terra sua, et exiissent de Ægypto, et habitassent in deserto per annos multos:
verses.english: And after these things, when they had provoked Him, and fled from Him, and retreated from their own land, and left Egypt, and lived in the desert for many years:

verses.latin: Et cum irasceretur eis Deus omnis terræ, jussit eos ire in regionem Amorrhæorum, et omnes Chananæos, Pherezæos, et Hethæos, et Hievæos, et Jebusæos, qui erant in deserto per annos multos.
verses.english: And when the God of all the earth became angry with them, He commanded them to go into the region of the Amorites, and all the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hittites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who had been in the desert for many years.

verses.latin: Et habitabant illic annis multis, dum irasceretur Deus in eos.
verses.english: And they lived there for many years while God remained angry with them.

verses.latin: Et post hæc, cum commovissent eos, et fugissent ab eo, et recessissent de terra sua, et exiissent de Ægypto, et habitassent in deserto per annos multos:
verses.english: And after these things, when they had provoked Him, and fled from Him, and retreated from their own land, and left Egypt, and lived in the desert for many years:

verses.latin: Et cum irasceretur eis Deus omnis terræ, jussit eos ire in regionem Amorrhæorum, et omnes Chananæos, Pherezæos, et Hethæos, et Hievæos, et Jebusæos, qui erant in deserto per annos multos.
verses.english: And when the God of all the earth became angry with them, He commanded them to go into the region of the Amorites, and all the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hittites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who had been in the desert for many years.

verses.latin: Et habitabant illic annis multis, dum irasceretur Deus in eos.
verses.english: And they lived there for many years while God remained angry with them.

verses.latin: Et post hæc, cum commovissent eos, et fugissent ab eo, et recessissent de terra sua, et exiissent de Ægypto, et habitassent in deserto per annos multos:
verses.english: And after these things, when they had provoked Him, and fled from Him, and retreated from their own land, and left Egypt, and lived in the desert for many years:

verses.latin: Et dixit Holofernes ad Achior: Quia ex Judæa es, et velut de captivis Israel, hæc locutus es, quasi non mutem sententiam meam ut non maligne agas.
verses.english: Holofernes said to Achior: "Because you are from Judea, and like one of the captives from Israel, you have spoken these words to me as if I would not change my mind and act against you with malice."

verses.latin: Sed ne putes te vivere, cum despicis virtutem Holofernis.
verses.english: But do not think you will survive, while you despise the strength and power of Holofernes.

verses.latin: Et hoc feceris, cum non statim fueris transmigratus de terra nostra, sed simul colligeris ad montem.
verses.english: And this will happen to you—you will not live—because you will not immediately be allowed to leave our land. Instead, you will be taken to the mountain where your people are gathered.

verses.latin: Ut cum interciderint gladius oris mei, et tu pariter intereas cum illis, cognoscas quia deus sum omnium terrarum.
verses.english: So that, when the sword of my mouth has cut them down, and you likewise perish along with them, you will know that I am the god over all the lands.

verses.latin: Et probabis quia Holofernes sit qui perdere te potest, et omnem terram montanam.
verses.english: And you will prove that it is Holofernes who has the power to destroy you and all the mountainous land.

verses.latin: Et jussit Holofernes ministris suis, qui stabant in atrio suo, ut comprehenderent Achior, et ducerent in Bethuliam, et traderent illum in manus filiorum Israël.
verses.english: And Holofernes commanded his servants, who were standing in his courtyard, to seize Achior and lead him to Bethulia, and to hand him over into the hands of the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Et accipientes eum servi Holofernis, abierunt per campestria, et de planitie ascenderunt in montanis, et venerunt ad fontes qui erant subter Bethuliam.
verses.english: And the servants of Holofernes, taking him, went through the plains. From the flatland, they ascended into the mountains and came to the springs that were below Bethulia.

verses.latin: Utque appropinquarunt portis civitatis, alligatum Achior funibus dimiserunt, et dereliquerunt eum, et reversi sunt ad Holofernem.
verses.english: When they approached the city gates, they let Achior down, bound with ropes, and left him there. Then they returned to Holofernes.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israël de civitate sua descendentes, venerunt ad eum, et solventes eum adduxerunt ad Bethuliam, et præsentaverunt in medio plebis suæ.
verses.english: But the sons of Israel, coming down from their city, came to him. They untied him and brought him to Bethulia, presenting him in the midst of their people.

verses.latin: Interrogavitque eum Ozias, princeps civitatis, quis aut unde esset, aut quare a Syris relictus fuisset.
verses.english: And Ozias, the leader of the city, questioned him as to who he was, or from where he came, or why he had been left behind by the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Qui respondens, in medio principum, et omnium sedens, narravit illis omnia verba consilii Holofernis, et quomodo ipse locutus fuisset in medio Assyriorum, et quemadmodum jussisset Holofernes ut hunc, hac de causa, traderent illis.
verses.english: He responded, sitting in the midst of the leaders and all the people, and told them all the words of Holofernes' counsel. He recounted how he himself had spoken in the midst of the Assyrians and how Holofernes had commanded that, for this reason, he be handed over to the Israelites.

verses.latin: Et ideo precamini Deum cæli, ut dignetur mittere judicium suum super exercitum eorum, quoniam sicut exprobravit me, sic et tuæ confusionis dignatus est recordari.
verses.english: And therefore, pray to the God of the universe to deign to send His judgment upon their army, for just as he reproached me, so also has he deigned to remember your disgrace.

verses.latin: Et contremuit omnis populus cum cecinit Achior verba hæc, et proni in terram adorantes Dominum, in unisiona voce dixerunt:
verses.english: And all the people trembled when Achior spoke these words, and prostrating themselves on the ground, they adored the Lord, saying with one voice:

verses.latin: Domine Deus cæli et terræ, intuere superbiam eorum, et respice ad nostram humilitatem, et fac faciem tuam ad eos qui temptant te, et in his qui sperant in te ostende virtutem tuam.
verses.english: Lord God of the universe and the earth, look upon their arrogance, and regard our humility. Turn your face against those who test you, and in those who hope in you, show your power.

verses.latin: Et nunc, frater, non desperes animam tuam, quoniam nos suscipiemus te, et simul moriemur, vel simul vivemus.
verses.english: And now, brother, do not despair for your life, because we will take you in. Together we will die, or together we will live.

verses.latin: Quia tu nostri memoratus es in conspectu Holofernis, et audivit Dominus verba tua, propterea et nos pro te faciemus rem hanc bonam.
verses.english: Because you remembered us in the presence of Holofernes, and the Lord heard your words, therefore we also will do this good thing for you.

verses.latin: Et benedixit illi Ozias, et promisit se recipere eum in Bethuliam, ut et illi deessent qui eum de civitate proici vellent.
verses.english: And Ozias blessed him and promised to take him into Bethulia, so that those who wished to cast him out of the city would also be lacking in their purpose.

verses.latin: Et adduxerunt eum in domum Ozias, et fecit convivium magnum Achior. Et convocavit omnes seniores ad convivium.
verses.english: And they brought him to the house of Ozias, who made a great feast for Achior. Ozias also called all the elders to the feast.

verses.latin: Et post hæc, omnes rogaverunt Dominum Israël, ut dignaretur liberare populum suum.
verses.english: And after this, all of them implored the Lord of Israel, that He would deign to deliver His people.

verses.latin: Et postridie congregato omni exercitu virorum fortium in auxilium uxorum, et filiorum, et conservandarum civitatum suarum, jussit Ozias omnis habitantes in Bethulia, et omnes habitantes in terra sua, descendere in universa animalia sua, in puteos aquarum, et absumere aquam, et jussit ut conservarent aquam ad necessitatem.
verses.english: And the next day, after all the army of strong men were gathered to help their wives and children and to preserve their cities, Ozias commanded all who lived in Bethulia, and all who lived in their land, to descend with all their animals to the water wells, and to consume the water, and he commanded that they conserve water for necessity.

verses.latin: Et jussit omnes mulieres, et pueros, et omnes puellas, et omnes annosas, et omnes pueros, et omnes adolescentes, et omnes infantes, ad aquas descendere.
verses.english: And he commanded all the women, and boys, and all the girls, and all the elderly, and all the young men, and all the infants to descend to the waters.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt omnes, viri, et mulieres, et pueri, et omnes annosi, et omnes juvenes, et omnes infantes, et omnes annosæ, et omnes pueri, ad aquas.
verses.english: And all gathered, men, and women, and boys, and all the elderly, and all the young people, and all the infants, and all the aged women, and all the children, to the waters.

verses.latin: Et omnes potaverunt aquam usque ad sitiendum, et non erat aqua in puteis ad satiandum.
verses.english: And all drank water until they were thirsty, and there was no water in the wells to satisfy them.

verses.latin: Et factum est ut, post dies viginti, defecit aqua in cisternis, et non erat in civitate aqua ad potandum omnibus civibus, et mulieribus, et pueris, et viris, et omnibus qui in civitate erant.
verses.english: And it came to pass that, after twenty days, the water in the cisterns failed. There was no water in the city for drinking for all the citizens, and women, and children, and men, and everyone who was in the city.

verses.latin: Et collecti sunt omnes in civitate, pueri, et mulieres, et seniores, ad Oziam, et ad omnes principes civitatis, et clamantes dixerunt:
verses.english: And all in the city gathered—children, and women, and elders—to Ozias and to all the leaders of the city, and crying out, they said:

verses.latin: Judicet Deus inter nos et te, quoniam nos fecisti fame et siti mori, et tradidisti nos in manus Assyriorum.
verses.english: May God judge between us and you, for you have made us die of hunger and thirst, and you have delivered us into the hands of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Et nunc, cur non tradis civitatem nostram in manus Assyriorum, ut moriamur, et non sit nobis hæc pœna, quam videmus, fame, et siti, et morte æterna, et omnibus iniquitatibus nostris, ut non audiamus clamorem mulierum nostrarum, et puerorum, et filiarum nostrarum, quas videmus, fame, et siti, et morte æterna.
verses.english: And now, why do you not surrender our city into the hands of the Assyrians, so that we may die, and not endure this punishment we now face: perpetual hunger, thirst, and death, because of all our iniquities? Why do we have to hear the cries of our wives, and our children, and our daughters, whom we see suffering from hunger, and thirst, and eternal death?

verses.latin: Et nunc, scimus quia non est in nobis salus, et quærimus nos tradere, et non moriamur in conspectu eorum, quos scimus esse misericordes.
verses.english: And now, we know that there is no salvation for us. We seek to surrender, so that we may not die in the sight of those whom we know to be merciful.

verses.latin: Quoniam melius est nos servire Assyriis, quam mori in conspectu eorum, quos scimus esse misericordes, et ut non audiamus clamorem mulierum nostrarum, et puerorum, et filiarum nostrarum, quas videmus, fame, et siti, et morte æterna.
verses.english: For it is better for us to serve the Assyrians than to die in the sight of those whom we know to be merciful, and not to hear the cries of our wives, and our children, and our daughters, whom we see suffering from hunger, and thirst, and eternal death.

verses.latin: Et nunc, scimus quia non est in nobis salus, et quærimus nos tradere, et non moriamur in conspectu eorum, quos scimus esse misericordes.
verses.english: And now, we know that there is no salvation for us. We seek to surrender, so that we may not die in the sight of those whom we know to be merciful.

verses.latin: Et nunc, rogamus te, ut digneris dare nobis ad huc quinque dies, ut in his diebus videamus, si forte mutet Dominus Deus noster consilium, et dignetur misereri nostri.
verses.english: And now, we ask you to deign to give us five more days, so that in these days we may see if perhaps the Lord our God changes His plan and deigns to have mercy on us.

verses.latin: Quoniam non dereliquet in totum homines suos, et si forte vult, ut nos, et in conspectu omnium gentium, non relinquat nos.
verses.english: For He will not entirely abandon His people. And if He wills it, He will not leave us to perish in the sight of all nations.

verses.latin: Et si forte vult, ut nos, et in conspectu omnium gentium, non relinquat nos, dignetur liberare nos.
verses.english: And if He wills it, He will not leave us to perish in the sight of all nations, but will deign to deliver us.

verses.latin: Et Ozias dixit ad illos: Credite mihi, quia non trademus vos, nisi per hoc tempus quod dixi vobis, si non viderimus auxilium Dei nostri, et nos faciemus quod dixistis.
verses.english: And Ozias said to them: "Believe me, we will not surrender you, unless by this time I have told you, if we do not see the help of our God, then we will do as you have said."

verses.latin: Et juravit ad illos, et omnes populi jurabant, et dicebant: Amen.
verses.english: And he swore to them, and all the people swore, and said: "Amen." (Meaning, 'So be it.')

verses.latin: Et discesserunt omnes in civitatem, et non erat aqua ad potandum omnibus civibus, et mulieribus, et pueris, et viris, et omnibus qui in civitate erant.
verses.english: And all returned into the city, and there was no water for drinking for all the citizens, and women, and children, and men, and everyone who was in the city.

verses.latin: Et post hæc, omnis populus deprecabatur Dominum, ut dignaretur misereri eorum, et ut dignaretur liberare eos.
verses.english: And after this, all the people implored the Lord, that He would deign to have mercy on them, and that He would deign to deliver them.

verses.latin: Et omnis populus dicebat: Amen.
verses.english: And all the people said: "Amen." (Meaning, 'So be it.')

verses.latin: Et factum est in diebus illis, ut Judæa non esset sine auxiliis, et Bethuliam non essent sine auxiliis.
verses.english: And it came to pass in those days that Judea was not without aid, and Bethulia was not without aid.

verses.latin: Et omnes gentes in Bethuliam venerunt, et in omnes civitates Judææ, et in omnes civitates Samariæ, et in omnes civitates Galileæ, et in omnes civitates regionis Philistiim, et in omnes civitates regionis Ascalonitarum, et in omnes civitates regionis Azotiorum, et in omnes civitates regionis Accaronitarum, et in omnes civitates regionis Getthæorum, et in omnes civitates regionis Gadaranorum, et in omnes civitates regionis Samariæ, et in omnes civitates regionis Galileæ.
verses.english: And all the nations came to Bethulia, and to all the cities of Judea, and to all the cities of Samaria, and to all the cities of Galilee, and to all the cities of the region of the Philistines, and to all the cities of the region of the Ascalonites, and to all the cities of the region of the Azotians, and to all the cities of the region of the Accaronites, and to all the cities of the region of the Getthites, and to all the cities of the region of the Gadarenes, and to all the cities of the region of Samaria, and to all the cities of the region of Galilee.

verses.latin: Et audientes filii Israel quia castraverat Holofernes omnem montanam per mediam eorum, perrexerunt et foderunt cisternas in omnem altitudinem montis excelsi.
verses.english: When the children of Israel heard that Holofernes had taken up positions throughout all the mountainous region where they lived, they went and dug cisterns all over the highest mountain.

verses.latin: Ascenderuntque filii Israel in montem Bethel, et in Besthom, et in Chobai, et in Aetnan, et in Salem, et in Theco, et in Abelmai, et in omnia loca fontium aquarum.
verses.english: And the children of Israel went up to Mount Bethel, and to Besthom, and to Chobai, and to Aetnan, and to Salem, and to Theco, and to Abelmai, and to all the places where there were springs of water.

verses.latin: Et castraverunt Holofernes et omnis exercitus ejus, turmae eorum magnae nimis, usque ad centum septuaginta millia virorum et duodecim millia equitum, et cameli innumerabiles, et asini, et muli eorum nimis multi, et haec multitudo copiosa.
verses.english: Holofernes and his entire army then set up camp. Their troops were immensely large, numbering one hundred seventy thousand men and twelve thousand horsemen. There were also countless camels, donkeys, and mules with them, making it an incredibly vast multitude.

verses.latin: Et castraverunt in latitudinem vallis juxta Bethuliam, ad fontem sitam in campo suo, et extenderunt se in latitudinem, ab Dothaim usque Gabee, ad solem.
verses.english: They set up their camp across the wide valley near Bethulia, at the spring located in its field. Their forces stretched out across the plain, from Dothaim all the way to Gabee, extending eastward.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israel succenderunt ignes in turribus suis, et tota nocte erant excubantes per gyrum, custodiæ causa sui.
verses.english: However, the children of Israel lit fires in their watchtowers. They remained on guard all night, watching all around to protect themselves.

verses.latin: Et appropinquavit Holofernes ad fontem aquæ eorum cum omni equitatu suo, qui erant cum eo: et occupavit eam, et posuit ibi custodes equites, et armigeros de exercitu Assyriorum.
verses.english: Holofernes then approached their water spring with all his cavalry that was with him. He occupied it and placed his cavalry guards there, along with armed men from the Assyrian army.

verses.latin: Et intravit ad filios Israel in montes, et ascendit ad Bethuliam, et occupavit omnes aditus civitatis.
verses.english: He then advanced against the children of Israel into the mountains. He went up to Bethulia and occupied all the entrances to the city.

verses.latin: Et posuit juxta aquæductum eorum agmen hominum mille ducentorum equitum, et cum eis pedites viginti millia.
verses.english: Near their aqueduct, he positioned a troop of twelve hundred cavalrymen, and with them, twenty thousand foot soldiers.

verses.latin: Et perrexerunt ad vallem cum virtute sua, et ascenderunt in montem aquæ Bethuliæ, et occupaverunt omnem aquam, et fontem aquarum eorum, et erant ibi cum illis.
verses.english: They proceeded into the valley with all their might. They went up to the water source of Bethulia and seized all the water, including their spring, and remained there with their forces.

verses.latin: Et accessit princeps filiorum Ammon, Achior, ad Holofernem, et dixit: Audi, domine mi, verbum ex ore servi tui, et loquar in conspectu tuo veritatem, et non exiet de ore tuo mendacium.
verses.english: Then the leader of the children of Ammon, Achior, approached Holofernes and said: "Listen, my lord, to a word from the mouth of your servant. I will speak the truth in your presence, and no lie will come from my mouth."

verses.latin: Populus iste, qui habitat in montanis, fidelis est Dei vivi: et propterea non est possibile, ut percussi sint ab his, qui volunt impetere eos, nisi si a Deo suo discesserint.
verses.english: "This people, who live in the mountains, are faithful to the living God. Therefore, it is impossible for them to be defeated by those who wish to attack them, unless they have turned away from their God."

verses.latin: Quia quotiescumque derelinquunt eum, in proelium dati sunt ad ignominiam: et quotiescumque pœnitentiam egerunt, a Deo cæli data est eis virtus ad resistendum.
verses.english: "For whenever they abandon Him, they are given over in battle to disgrace. And whenever they perform acts of repentance, strength to resist is given to them by the God of heaven."

verses.latin: Dixitque Holofernes ad Achior: Quis es tu, qui prophetaris nobis sicut hodie, et dicis ut non impugnemus populum Israel, propterea quia Deus illorum defendit illos?
verses.english: Holofernes said to Achior: "Who are you to prophesy to us today and say that we should not attack the people of Israel, just because their God defends them?"

verses.latin: Et quasi per ignem comburam, qui te misit de terra tua, si vel minimum ex dictis tuis retrocedere ausus fueris.
verses.english: "And I will burn alive the one who sent you from your land, if you dare to retract even the smallest part of what you have said."

verses.latin: Et ne existimes, quod non possim fortius resistere Deo tuo: sed quando scivero quoniam tuæ prophetiæ non complebuntur, tunc usque ad finem conficiam te.
verses.english: "Do not think that I cannot resist your God more strongly. But when I know that your prophecies will not come true, then I will utterly destroy you."

verses.latin: Et nunc, ut scias quia omnis spiritus superat omnem Deum, et omnis virtus mea fortior est omnibus viribus: noli tu mentiri tibi, dicens quia non possum vincere populum istum, qui sedet in montibus.
verses.english: "And now, so you may know that every spirit overcomes every god, and all my power is stronger than all powers, do not lie to yourself by saying that I cannot conquer this people who live in the mountains."

verses.latin: Noli timere faciem meam, nec cor tuum conteratur, si dixeris mihi verbum istud.
verses.english: "Do not fear my presence, nor let your heart be crushed, if you have spoken this word to me."

verses.latin: Sed si dicis mihi quia fortior est Deus tuus, quid est hoc, quod non vis ut adducerem tibi, et offerrem illum in sacrificium meum?
verses.english: "But if you tell me that your God is stronger, why is it that you do not want me to bring Him to you and offer Him as my sacrifice?"

verses.latin: Et jussit, et adduxerunt Achior de castris, et duxerunt eum ad Bethuliam, et dimiserunt eum ligatum in arbore, ut tollerent de eo omnem veritatem, si vellet annuntiare eam populo suo.
verses.english: Then he gave the order, and they brought Achior out of the camp. They led him to Bethulia and left him tied to a tree so that they might get all the truth from him, should he choose to announce it to his people.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt ad Holofernem, et nuntiaverunt ei omnia quæ fecerant Achior, et dimiserunt eum in arbore, ad Bethuliam.
verses.english: And they returned to Holofernes and reported to him everything they had done with Achior, including leaving him tied to a tree near Bethulia.

verses.latin: Et accensus est iracundia Holofernes in Achior, et dixit ei: Si non fueris in civitate hac, ut videam tibi quod iniquitatem in te fecerim, ne unquam adorem te, neque tibi aliquid faciam.
verses.english: Holofernes became inflamed with anger at Achior and said to him: "If you are not in this city, so that I may see the evil I will inflict on you, I will never worship you, nor do anything for you."

verses.latin: Sed si transieris in terram, quam tu dixisti, adora me, et faciam te in filium meum.
verses.english: "But if you go into the land you mentioned, worship me, and I will make you my son."

verses.latin: Et jussit, ut nuntiantes ei Achior, nuntiarent omnia quæ fecerant Achior in civitate.
verses.english: And he commanded that those who had reported Achior to him should report everything Achior had done in the city.

verses.latin: Et misit ad omnem provinciam Assyriorum, ut congregarent exercitum, et ascenderent in Bethuliam, et caperent eam.
verses.english: He sent word to every province of the Assyrians, commanding them to gather an army and march to Bethulia to capture it.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt omnes, et ascenderunt in Bethuliam, et castraverunt contra eam, et obsederunt eam diebus triginta.
verses.english: And all were gathered, and they marched to Bethulia, and set up camp against it, besieging it for thirty days.

verses.latin: Et defecerunt aquæ, et cibaria eorum in civitate.
verses.english: During this time, their water and food supplies within the city began to run out.

verses.latin: Et cum vidissent filii Israel, quod defecerunt aquæ, et cibaria eorum, et quod multi deficiebant in civitate, et quod mortui erant, quicumque voluerunt bibere de aquis, deficiebant.
verses.english: When the children of Israel saw that their water and food supplies were failing, and that many in the city were growing weak, and that whoever tried to drink from the waters was dying, they knew the situation was dire.

verses.latin: Et omnes mulieres et viri, juvenes et senes, pueri et puellæ, congregati sunt ad Oziam, et ad principes civitatis, et dixerunt:
verses.english: Then all the women and men, young and old, boys and girls, gathered around Ozias and the leaders of the city and said:

verses.latin: Judicet Dominus inter nos et vos, quia fecistis nobis iniquitatem, non volentes loqui cum Assyriis, sed volentes nos tradere in manibus eorum ad ignominiam, et in mortem.
verses.english: "May the Lord judge between us and you, because you have done us wrong! You were unwilling to speak with the Assyrians, preferring to hand us over into their hands for disgrace and death."

verses.latin: Et nunc perimus fame et siti: et jam non possumus resistere illis.
verses.english: "And now we are perishing from hunger and thirst. We can no longer resist them."

verses.latin: Sed nunc congrega populum, et dic eis, ut exeant ad Holofernem, et tradant se in manibus ejus: et non permittas nos mori.
verses.english: "So now, gather the people and tell them to go out to Holofernes and surrender themselves into his hands. Do not allow us to die."

verses.latin: Et dixit Ozias: Audite, fratres mei, et ego quoque non sum contentus, quod tradamus nos in manibus inimicorum nostrorum: sed non possum facere vobiscum, quod petistis.
verses.english: Ozias said: "Listen, my brothers, I am also not pleased that we should surrender ourselves into the hands of our enemies. But I cannot do with you what you have requested."

verses.latin: Sed si vultis expectare diebus quinque, usque dum Dominus Deus noster miseretur nostri, et mittet nobis auxilium: et si non miseretur nostri, et non mittet nobis auxilium, faciemus vobiscum, quod petistis.
verses.english: "But if you are willing to wait five days, until the Lord our God has mercy on us and sends us help: then, if He does not have mercy on us and does not send us help, we will do with you what you have requested."

verses.latin: Et dixit Ozias: Scio quoniam hæc est causa, quare vos vexat Deus noster: ut probaret vos, si digni estis Deo suo.
verses.english: And Ozias said: "I know that this is the reason why our God is troubling you: to test you, to see if you are worthy of your God."

verses.latin: Sed nolite deficere in tempore tribulationis: sed sperate in Deum, ut perveniat ad vos misericordia ejus.
verses.english: "But do not lose heart in this time of tribulation. Instead, hope in God, so that His mercy may reach you."

verses.latin: Et si vultis, ut in diebus quinque speremus in eo, et si non miseretur nostri, et non mittet nobis auxilium, faciemus vobiscum, quod petistis.
verses.english: "And if you wish that we hope in Him for five days, and if He does not have mercy on us and does not send us help, we will do with you what you have requested."

verses.latin: Et dixit omnis populus: Faciemus vobiscum, quod dixistis: sed non moriamur in via.
verses.english: And all the people said: "We will do with you what you have said, but let us not die on the way!"

verses.latin: Et juraverunt Ozias et principes civitatis, et dixerunt: In nomine Domini, et in nomine Dei nostri, et in nomine patrum nostrorum, faciemus vobiscum, quod petistis.
verses.english: Ozias and the leaders of the city swore an oath and said: "In the name of the Lord, and in the name of our God, and in the name of our fathers, we will do with you what you have requested."

verses.latin: Et juraverunt omnis populus, et dixerunt: In nomine Domini, et in nomine Dei nostri, et in nomine patrum nostrorum, faciemus vobiscum, quod petistis.
verses.english: And all the people swore an oath and said: "In the name of the Lord, and in the name of our God, and in the name of our fathers, we will do with you what you have requested."

verses.latin: Et juraverunt Ozias et principes civitatis, et dixerunt: In nomine Domini, et in nomine Dei nostri, et in nomine patrum nostrorum, faciemus vobiscum, quod petistis.
verses.english: Ozias and the leaders of the city then swore another oath and said: "In the name of the Lord, and in the name of our God, and in the name of our fathers, we will do with you what you have requested."

verses.latin: Audivit autem hæc Judith vidua filia Merari filii Ox filii Joseph filii Oziel filii Elchiæ filii Ananiæ filii Gedeon filii Raphaim filii Achitob filii Melchiæ filii Enan filii Nathaniæ filii Salathiel filii Simeon filii Ruben:
verses.english: Now, Judith, a widow, heard all these things. She was the daughter of Merari. Merari was the son of Ox, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Oziel, who was the son of Elchia, who was the son of Anania, who was the son of Gedeon, who was the son of Raphaim, who was the son of Achitob, who was the son of Melchia, who was the son of Enan, who was the son of Nathania, who was the son of Salathiel, who was the son of Simeon, who was the son of Ruben.

verses.latin: Et vir ejus Manasses mortuus est in diebus messis hordei:
verses.english: And her husband, Manasses, had died during the days of the barley harvest.

verses.latin: Erat enim coarctans ligandos fasciculos in agro, et aestus irruit super caput ejus, et in lecto suo mortuus est, et sepultus est cum patribus suis in Bethulia.
verses.english: He had been binding bundles of grain in the field, when intense heat overcame him. He died in his bed and was buried with his ancestors in Bethulia.

verses.latin: Fuerat autem Judith relicta ejus vidua jam annis tribus et mensibus sex.
verses.english: Now, Judith had been his widow for three years and six months.

verses.latin: Et fecerat sibi tabernaculum in superioribus domus suæ, et in eo manebat inclusa cum ancillis suis.
verses.english: She had made a private tent for herself on the roof of her house, and she lived there in seclusion with her maids.

verses.latin: Et cilicio super lumbos suos, et veste viduitatis, jejunabat omnibus diebus vitæ suæ, exceptis sabbatis, et neomeniis, et diebus festis domus Israël.
verses.english: She wore sackcloth around her waist and the garments of a widow. She fasted every day of her life, except on Sabbaths, New Moon days, and the feast days of the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Erat autem valde decora aspectu, et mulier honesta nimis: denique vir ejus Manasses reliquerat illi domum, et substantiam optimam, et agros segetesque frumenti, boves etiam et oves.
verses.english: She was very beautiful to look at, and a most honorable woman. Indeed, her husband Manasses had left her a house, a very good fortune, fields, and harvests of grain, as well as oxen and sheep.

verses.latin: Et hæc omnia conservabat vidua, sic ut non esset qui eam posset reprehendere in ullo verbo.
verses.english: And the widow carefully managed all these things, so that no one could find fault with her in any way.

verses.latin: Omnes enim laudabant eam valde, eo quod timeret Dominum, in tantum ut non esset qui loqueretur de illa verbum malum.
verses.english: Everyone praised her highly, because she feared the Lord. So much so that there was no one who spoke any evil word about her.

verses.latin: At ubi audiit Judith quoniam Holofernes instaret civitati, noluit exire de domo sua, nec de suis tabernaculi secretis non deserere.
verses.english: But when Judith heard that Holofernes was pressing against the city, she refused to leave her house, nor would she abandon the privacy of her tent.

verses.latin: Et hæc omnia loquebantur in populo secundum quod dixerat Ozias. Et jam defecerant omnes aquæ, et condensa erat civitas, et non erat in medio eorum unde aut reficerent animas suas, aut sitim tollerent.
verses.english: And all these things were being spoken among the people, just as Ozias had said. All the water had now failed, and the city was in great distress. There was nothing left among them to refresh themselves or to quench their thirst.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt omnes viri et mulieres et parvuli in conspectum Oziæ, et omnium principum civitatis, et dicentes omnibus:
verses.english: And all the men, women, and children gathered before Ozias and all the leaders of the city, saying to them all:

verses.latin: Propitius sit vobis Deus, et det pacem.
verses.english: “May God be merciful to you, and grant us peace.”

verses.latin: Quia jam defecimus, et omnis homo noster mortuus est a siti.
verses.english: “Because we have now completely failed, and every one of our people is dying from thirst.”

verses.latin: Et nunc congregate omnes viros, qui sunt in civitate: ut percutiamus omnes adversarios nostros, et si potuerimus, interficiamus eos: et si non, moriamur ipsi, et videamus oculos uxorum nostrarum, et infantum nostrorum morientes.
verses.english: “So now, gather all the men who are in the city, so that we may attack all our adversaries. If we can, we will kill them; if not, we ourselves will die. Let us not see our wives and our children dying before our eyes.”

verses.latin: Obtestamur vos per Deum nostrum, ut faciatis nobis sicut diximus.
verses.english: “We implore you, by our God, to do for us as we have said.”

verses.latin: Et dixit illis Ozias: Fratres, estote æquanimes, et sustinete adhuc dies quinque, in quibus expectemus a Domino misericordiam.
verses.english: And Ozias said to them: “Brothers, be of good courage, and bear with us for five more days, during which we will wait for mercy from the Lord.”

verses.latin: Quia in tantum non deserit Dominus, ut si hi dies transierint, et non venerit adjutorium nobis, faciam vobis secundum verbum vestrum.
verses.english: “For the Lord does not forsake us to such an extent that if these days pass and no help comes to us, I will act according to your word.”

verses.latin: Et cum hæc dixisset, dissolverunt plebem singuli in castra sua: et constituerunt super muros et turres civitatis suæ.
verses.english: And when he had said these things, they dismissed the people, each one to his camp. And they set guards over the walls and towers of their city.

verses.latin: Et miserunt unumquemque in stationem suam. Et cum hæc omnia audisset Judith, misit ancillam suam qua vocaret Oziam, et Chabrin, et Charmin, senes civitatis.
verses.english: And they sent everyone to his post. And when Judith had heard all these things, she sent her maid to call Ozias, and Chabris, and Charmis, the elders of the city.

verses.latin: Veneruntque ad illam, et dixit illis: Quid est istud verbum, in quo consensistis, ut tradatis civitatem nostram Assyriis, si intra quinque dies non venerit vobis auxilium?
verses.english: And they came to her, and she said to them: “What is this word, to which you have agreed, that you would surrender our city to the Assyrians if help does not come to you within five days?”

verses.latin: Et qui vos estis, qui tentatis Dominum?
verses.english: “And who are you, that you put the Lord to the test?”

verses.latin: Istud non est verbum quod firmat corda hominum, et dat spiritum: sed quod ad iracundiam provocat, et accendit furorem.
verses.english: “This is not a word that strengthens the hearts of men and gives spirit, but rather one that provokes to anger and ignites fury.”

verses.latin: Deditis vos ipsos terminum temporis Domino, et posuistis illi diem ex arbitrio vestro.
verses.english: “You have set a time limit for the Lord yourselves, and you have appointed a day for Him according to your own will.”

verses.latin: Sed quoniam Dominus patientissimus est, ideo vos corripit, et ostendit vobis exemplum iracundiæ suæ: in qua nescitis quid faciat vobis.
verses.english: “But because the Lord is most patient, He therefore reproves you and shows you an example of His wrath, in which you do not know what He will do to you.”

verses.latin: Sed jam scimus, quia nos vendidimus, ut tradamur in manibus inimicorum nostrorum: quoniam non est nobis adjutor de vobis.
verses.english: “But we now know that we have sold ourselves, to be handed over into the hands of our enemies, because there is no helper for us from among you.”

verses.latin: Vos autem fratres mei, nolite tentare Dominum Deum nostrum.
verses.english: “But you, my brothers, do not test the Lord our God.”

verses.latin: Quia si non placuerit illi in quinque diebus auxiliari nobis, habet potestatem, qualem et in quibus diebus voluerit, liberare nos, aut percutere in conspectu inimicorum nostrorum.
verses.english: “For if it does not please Him to help us within five days, He has the power, in whatever way and on whatever days He wishes, to deliver us or to strike us down in the sight of our enemies.”

verses.latin: Sed ne astringatis consilia Domini Dei nostri: quia non sicut homo, sic et Deus, neque sicut filius hominis, ita et filius hominis.
verses.english: “But do not bind the counsels of the Lord our God, because God is not like man, nor is the Son of Man like the son of man in wisdom or power.”

verses.latin: Unde cum patientiam expectemus ab eo, et consolationem, nolite irasci contra eum, sed humiliemini sub manum ejus.
verses.english: “Therefore, since we await patience and consolation from Him, do not be angry against Him, but humble yourselves under His hand.”

verses.latin: Quoniam si non fuerit in diebus quinque auxiliari nobis, et ipse voluerit in tempore quo voluerit: nihilominus eum orabimus ut liberet nos.
verses.english: “For if He does not choose to help us within five days, and if He Himself wills it at a time when He chooses, nevertheless we will pray to Him that He may deliver us.”

verses.latin: Sed et tu Judith noli tentare Deum: hæc enim omnia opera Dei sunt.
verses.english: “But also, you, Judith, do not test God. For all these things are the works of God.”

verses.latin: Et cum hæc dixisset Ozias, dixit ad eum Judith: Quæ dixi vobis, non sunt secundum hominem loquens: sed secundum Deum dico vobis.
verses.english: And when Ozias had said these things, Judith said to him: “What I have said to you, I have not spoken as a human, but I speak to you according to God.”

verses.latin: Nam si vere tentatis eum, et non vult vos adjuvare intra hos quinque dies, ut vultis, non poteritis effugere manum ejus.
verses.english: “For if you truly test Him, and He does not wish to help you within these five days, as you desire, you will not be able to escape His hand.”

verses.latin: Et omnis domus Israël peribit in os vestrum.
verses.english: “And the entire house of Israel will perish because of your decisions.”

verses.latin: Aut quis estis vos, qui temptatis Dominum, et non est in vobis sensus?
verses.english: “Or who are you, who tempt the Lord, and there is no sense in you?”

verses.latin: Nunc autem videte quomodo nos morimur: et universus populus noster moritur, dum nemo sit qui nos adjuvare possit.
verses.english: “Now, however, you see how we are dying, and our entire people are dying, while there is no one who can help us.”

verses.latin: Et ecce, si non fuerit adjutorium, et nos non venerit super nos, hoc erit in conspectu Domini, ut audiat orationes nostras.
verses.english: “And behold, if there is no help, and it does not befall us, this situation will be before the Lord, so that He may hear our prayers.”

verses.latin: Et nunc fratres, quia vos estis duces populi, et in vobis est corda eorum:
verses.english: “And now, brothers, because you are the leaders of the people, and their hearts and courage depend on you:”

verses.latin: Et nunc, si verbum meum fuerit in ore vestro, non erit opus ullum, ut non sit adjutorium vestrum.
verses.english: “And now, if my word is on your lips and you follow it, no effort will be futile, and your help will certainly be at hand.”

verses.latin: Et clamavit Judith ad Dominum, dicens:
verses.english: Judith then cried out to the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Domine Deus meus, exaudi me ancillam tuam, et respice super opera mea: quia cogitavit Holofernes superbiam contra virtutem tuam, et dignitatem templi tui sanctificati, et contra altare tuum, quod erexisti.
verses.english: My Lord God, hear me, your handmaiden, and look upon my work—my mission to save Israel—because Holofernes has arrogantly thought to challenge your power, and the honor of your holy temple, and against your altar, which you yourself established.

verses.latin: Quia dixit, ut contaminaret et subverteret templum tuum, et altare tuum per potentiam suam.
verses.english: For he openly declared that he would defile and destroy your temple and your altar by his own might.

verses.latin: Ecce enim Assyrii multiplicati sunt in virtute sua: gloriantur in equis et equitibus, in virtute peditum, et in clipeis, et in lanceis, et in sagittis, et in fundis.
verses.english: Look now: the Assyrians have multiplied their forces and their power. They boast in their horses and cavalry, in the strength of their foot soldiers, and in their shields, lances, arrows, and slings.

verses.latin: Et nesciunt quoniam tu es Deus omnium, qui conteris bella ab initio, et Dominus est nomen tuum.
verses.english: And they do not know that you are the God of all creation, who crushes wars from the beginning of time—and Lord is your very Name.

verses.latin: Exalta brachium tuum sicut ab initio, et contere virtutem illorum in potestate tua: et cadet virtus illorum in interitu.
verses.english: Lift up your arm as you have done from the very beginning of Israel's history, and crush their power with your might. Then their strength will fall into complete ruin.

verses.latin: Quia dixit Holofernes: Aetatem meam ignorabit, et delebit terram meam.
verses.english: Because Holofernes declared, 'My generation will not remember their existence'—meaning he intends to wipe out Israel completely—'and I will destroy their land.'

verses.latin: Sed tu, Domine Deus, ne despicias virtutem tuam in his quae sunt per me, et fac quae locutus sum, et dirige propositum meum in consummationem.
verses.english: But you, Lord God, do not overlook your power in the things I am about to do, but make what I have said come true, and guide my purpose to its completion.

verses.latin: Quoniam potentia tua non est in multitudine, neque potestas tua in robustis consistit: sed humilium et mitium es Protector.
verses.english: For your power is not found in numbers, nor does your strength reside in the mighty. Instead, you are the Protector of the humble and the meek.

verses.latin: Tu es adjutor orborum, et susceptor pusillorum, et propugnator infirmorum, et Protector eorum qui sine spe sunt, et Salvator omnium sperantium in te.
verses.english: You are the helper of orphans, and the supporter of the lowly, and the champion of the weak, and the Protector of those who are without hope, and the Savior of all who hope in you.

verses.latin: Memor esto Domine testamenti tui, et juramenti tui, quod jurasti Isaac, et promissionis tuae, quam promisisti Jacob, in multiplicanda semina eorum.
verses.english: Remember, Lord, your covenant and your oath which you swore to Isaac, and your promise that you made to Jacob, to multiply their descendants.

verses.latin: Quia ab initio non fuisti tu qui indiges creaturarum nostrarum: sed qui facis in nobis virtutem tuam in hoc quod es.
verses.english: For from the beginning of time, you were not one who needed our created beings, but you are the one who works your power within us because of who you are.

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine, ecce, Assyrii inflati sunt in virtute sua, et exaltati sunt in equis et equitibus suis: gloriantur in brachio peditum suorum:
verses.english: And now, Lord, look: the Assyrians are puffed up in their own strength, and they are exalted in their horses and cavalry. They boast in the might of their foot soldiers.

verses.latin: spernunt te, et minantur sanctificationem tuam, et gloriam nominis tui. Dejice virtutem illorum in virtute tua, et contere potentiam illorum in furore tuo: quia dicunt: Non est qui resistat mihi. Esto mihi, Domine Deus meus, in adjutorium, et exaudi orationem meam: et da mihi sermonem et dolum in ore meo, ut decipiam eos. Quia in virtute tua est virtus mea, et in fortitudine tua exaltabitur cor meum. Quia in verbis meis decipies eos, et in specie vultus mei dejicies eos. Et cognoscet omnis gens, quia tu es Deus, qui conteris potentes in virtute tua. Amen.
verses.english: They despise you, and they threaten your holy places, and the glory of your Name. Cast down their strength with your own might, and crush their power with your divine fury, because they say, 'There is no one who can resist me!' Be my helper, Lord my God, and hear my prayer. And grant me words and clever deceit upon my lips, so that I may deceive them. For my strength comes from your power, and my heart will be exalted in your might. Because through my words you will deceive them, and through the appearance of my face you will cast them down. And every nation will know that you are God, who crushes the powerful by your might. Amen.

verses.latin: In die illa cecidit Judith in faciem suam, et cinere impexa est caput suum, et vestimento suo cilicino operuit se; et hora qua obtulerunt incensum illud diei in Jerusalem in templo Domini, procidens Judith super terram, aperuit os suum ad Dominum, dicens:
verses.english: On that specific day, Judith fell to the ground on her face, put ashes on her head, and covered herself with sackcloth. And at the very hour when the daily incense was offered in Jerusalem in the Temple of the Lord, Judith fell prostrate to the ground and opened her mouth to the Lord, praying:

verses.latin: Domine Deus patris mei Simeonis, dedisti illi gladium in defensione alienigenarum, qui violatorum lumborum aperuerunt pudorem in concupiscentiam, et denudaverunt femur in confusionem, et maculaverunt sanguinem in ira, et pollutam naturam imitati sunt.
verses.english: "Lord, God of my father Simeon, You gave him a sword to defend against the foreigners who, driven by lust, violated the private parts of women, shamelessly exposed them, stained blood in their anger, and acted against natural law."

verses.latin: Et dixisti: Non erit ita: et dederunt filiis eorum, ut denudarent se cum ipsis, et fecisti principes eorum ad internecionem, et cubile eorum, quod concupiscentiae maculatum est, in deceptionem.
verses.english: "And You said that such acts should not be. Yet they allowed their own sons to expose themselves with them in these acts. So You brought their leaders to utter destruction, and their beds, which were defiled by lust, became a snare for them."

verses.latin: Et percussisti viros eorum cum mulieribus eorum, et filios eorum in filiabus eorum in deceptionem; et nunc ego, Domine, imploro te, ut adiuves me, ancillam tuam, quae confido in te, et sola in te confido, et nihil aliud in vita mea.
verses.english: "And You struck down their men along with their women, and their sons with their daughters, bringing about their ruin. And now, Lord, I beg You to help me, Your handmaid, who trusts in You, and I trust in You alone; I have nothing else in my life."

verses.latin: Suscitasti enim praeterita, et ea quae postmodum, et quae nunc sunt, et futura, Tu fecisti in unum; et quae eveniunt, tu fecisti, et judicia tua praeparata sunt.
verses.english: "For You have called forth the past, and those things that happened afterward, and those things that exist now, and all things yet to come; You made them all into one unified plan. And the events that unfold, You caused them, and Your judgments are already prepared and certain."

verses.latin: Propter hoc, Domine, qui praeparasti omnia, et in omnibus judicia tua, respice nunc in hoc quod tibi vultum meum adnexo, et deprecationem meam ad te dirigo.
verses.english: "Because of this, Lord, You who have prepared all things, and whose judgments are in all things, look now upon this plea, to which I attach myself entirely to You, and I direct my supplication to You."

verses.latin: Quoniam exercitus Assyriorum crevit, et superbia eorum multiplicata est; et gladium eorum et exercitum eorum et homines eorum non curat ullus, sed in tuo nomine, ut per me, ancillam tuam, destruas eos, qui credunt se habere quod tibi opponant.
verses.english: "For the army of the Assyrians has grown vast, and their pride has multiplied. No one worries about their sword, their army, or their men, but in Your Name, I pray that through me, Your handmaid, You will destroy those who believe they have something they can use to oppose You."

verses.latin: Quoniam Tu es Deus omnipotens, et solus Deus, et non est alius qui tecum resistere possit.
verses.english: "For You are the Almighty God, and You alone are God, and there is no other who can stand against You."

verses.latin: Et respice nunc in castra Assyriorum, sicut respicere dignatus es in castra Aegyptiorum, cum persecuti sunt filios Israel in quadrigis, et in multitudine bellicorum hominum;
verses.english: "And look now upon the camp of the Assyrians, just as You deigned to look upon the camp of the Egyptians, when they pursued the children of Israel with their chariots and a multitude of warriors."

verses.latin: et operuisti agmina eorum, et mare operuit eos, et nomen eorum exstinctum est usque in hodiernum diem.
verses.english: "You covered their legions with the sea, and the sea drowned them, and their name has been extinguished even to this very day."

verses.latin: Ita facias et horum exercitui, Domine, et prostraveris omnem eorum exercitum;
verses.english: "Do the same for this army, Lord, and cast down their entire military force."

verses.latin: et per manum famulae tuae, ut fiat mihi confugium, et superbia eorum frangatur, et contritio eorum et omnes qui superbi sunt in nomine tuo.
verses.english: "And by the hand of Your maidservant, may I become a refuge for my people, and may their pride be broken, and their destruction brought upon them, and all who are proud in Your Name."

verses.latin: Et sciant omnes gentes quia tu es Deus, et non est alius praeter te.
verses.english: "And may all nations know that You are God, and there is no other besides You."

verses.latin: Et clamavit Judith voce magna ad Dominum, dicens: Deus Israel, exaudi me, ancillam tuam.
verses.english: And Judith cried out with a loud voice to the Lord, saying: "God of Israel, hear me, Your handmaid."

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Domine, Domine, Deus patris mei Simeon, dedisti gladium in manu ejus in vindictam adversum alienos, qui zelum illius ad iracundiam provocaverant, qui incestum operati sunt in semine suo, et maculaverunt latus Thamar, et maculaverunt eum, qui peperit illos.
verses.english: Then Judith prayed: "O Lord, O Lord, God of my father Simeon, you gave a sword into his hand for vengeance against foreigners, who had provoked his zeal to anger, who had committed incest in their seed, and had defiled the side of Thamar, and had defiled him who bore them.

verses.latin: Et dedisti mulieres eorum in direptionem, et filias eorum in captivitatem, et omnem prædam eorum divisisti inter filios tuos, qui zelo tui et horrore fornicationis tuæ exarserunt: adjuvisti me peccatricem, Domine Deus meus, ad vindictam adversus eos, qui fecerunt hæc.
verses.english: And you gave their wives over to plunder, and their daughters into captivity, and you divided all their spoil among your sons, who were inflamed with zeal for you and with horror at their fornication. You have helped me, a sinful woman, O Lord my God, to take vengeance against those who did these things.

verses.latin: Ecce enim Assyrii in virtute sua gloriati sunt, et in equis et in equitibus, in virtute peditum, et in fiducia scutorum, et in clypeorum tuorum fiducia, et in sagittis, et in balistis, et in omnis generis armis.
verses.english: For behold, the Assyrians have boasted in their own strength, and in their horses and horsemen, in the power of their foot soldiers, and in the confidence of their shields, and in the trust they place in their own defenses, and in their arrows, and in their catapults, and in all kinds of weapons.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Ascendemus in fines terræ, et hereditate accipiemus loca deserta, et universam terram, et capiemus omnes gentes, quæ in ea sunt, et omnes gentes, quæ habitant in ea, et universam terram.
verses.english: And they said: 'We will go up to the farthest parts of the earth, and we will inherit the desolate places and the entire land, and we will capture all the nations that are in it, and all the peoples who dwell there, and the entire land.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, Domine Deus cæli et terræ, creator aquarum, et rex omnis creaturæ, exaudi orationes meas.
verses.english: Now therefore, O Lord God of heaven and earth, creator of the waters, and King of every creature, hear my prayers.

verses.latin: Et fac consilium eorum, ut sciant quoniam tu es Deus omnipotens, et non est alius præter te qui pugnet pro Israël.
verses.english: And make their counsel come to naught, so that they may know that you are the Almighty God, and there is no other besides you who fights for Israel.

verses.latin: Et confunde in virtute tua arrogantiam eorum, et in gladio meo, confunde eos.
verses.english: And by your power, put their arrogance to confusion, and by my sword, confuse them.

verses.latin: Quia non in multitudine virorum est virtus tua, neque in multitudine peditum est fortitudo tua, sed in simplicitate orationis tuæ, et in virtute cordis tui, qui solus es Deus, potes liberare populum tuum.
verses.english: For your strength is not in a multitude of men, nor is your might in the number of foot soldiers, but in the simplicity of your prayer, and in the strength of your heart; you alone are God, and you can deliver your people.

verses.latin: Et fac consilium eorum ut sciant quoniam tu es Deus omnipotens, et non est alius præter te qui pugnet pro Israël.
verses.english: And make their counsel come to naught, so that they may know that you are the Almighty God, and there is no other besides you who fights for Israel.

verses.latin: Et confunde in virtute tua arrogantiam eorum, et in gladio meo, confunde eos.
verses.english: And by your power, put their arrogance to confusion, and by my sword, confuse them.

verses.latin: Quia non in multitudine virorum est virtus tua, neque in multitudine peditum est fortitudo tua, sed in simplicitate orationis tuæ, et in virtute cordis tui, qui solus es Deus, potes liberare populum tuum.
verses.english: For your strength is not in a multitude of men, nor is your might in the number of foot soldiers, but in the simplicity of your prayer, and in the strength of your heart; you alone are God, and you can deliver your people.

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Amen. Et cecidit in faciem suam in terram, et adoravit Deum, et dixit: Amen, amen, amen.
verses.english: And Judith said: 'Amen.' And she fell upon her face to the ground, and adored God, and said: 'Amen, amen, amen.'

verses.latin: Et exclamavit Judith ad Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es tu, Domine Deus omnipotens, et magnus es tu, et fortis es tu, et misericors es tu, et in te confido, et in te glorior, et in te me laudo.
verses.english: And Judith cried out to the Lord, and said: 'Blessed are you, O Lord, almighty God, and great are you, and strong are you, and merciful are you, and in you I trust, and in you I glory, and in you I praise myself.'

verses.latin: Et iterum exclamavit Judith ad Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es tu, Domine Deus omnipotens, et magnus es tu, et fortis es tu, et misericors es tu, et in te confido, et in te glorior, et in te me laudo.
verses.english: And again Judith cried out to the Lord, and said: 'Blessed are you, O Lord, almighty God, and great are you, and strong are you, and merciful are you, and in you I trust, and in you I glory, and in you I praise myself.'

verses.latin: Et iterum exclamavit Judith ad Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es tu, Domine Deus omnipotens, et magnus es tu, et fortis es tu, et misericors es tu, et in te confido, et in te glorior, et in te me laudo.
verses.english: And again Judith cried out to the Lord, and said: 'Blessed are you, O Lord, almighty God, and great are you, and strong are you, and merciful are you, and in you I trust, and in you I glory, and in you I praise myself.'

verses.latin: Et iterum exclamavit Judith ad Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es tu, Domine Deus omnipotens, et magnus es tu, et fortis es tu, et misericors es tu, et in te confido, et in te glorior, et in te me laudo.
verses.english: And again Judith cried out to the Lord, and said: 'Blessed are you, O Lord, almighty God, and great are you, and strong are you, and merciful are you, and in you I trust, and in you I glory, and in you I praise myself.'

verses.latin: Et iterum exclamavit Judith ad Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es tu, Domine Deus omnipotens, et magnus es tu, et fortis es tu, et misericors es tu, et in te confido, et in te glorior, et in te me laudo.
verses.english: And again Judith cried out to the Lord, and said: 'Blessed are you, O Lord, almighty God, and great are you, and strong are you, and merciful are you, and in you I trust, and in you I glory, and in you I praise myself.'

verses.latin: Et iterum exclamavit Judith ad Dominum, et dixit: Benedictus es tu, Domine Deus omnipotens, et magnus es tu, et fortis es tu, et misericors es tu, et in te confido, et in te glorior, et in te me laudo.
verses.english: And again Judith cried out to the Lord, and said: 'Blessed are you, O Lord, almighty God, and great are you, and strong are you, and merciful are you, and in you I trust, and in you I glory, and in you I praise myself.'

verses.latin: Post haec ut cessavit clamor, et fletus in civitate,
verses.english: After these things, when the crying and the mourning had stopped throughout the city,

verses.latin: surrexit Judith de nocte, et vocavit ancillam suam unam, quae præerat omnibus rebus illius.
verses.english: Judith rose up in the middle of the night and called her personal maidservant, who was in charge of all her affairs.

verses.latin: Et tulit ampullam olei, et unxit se unguento optimo: et compsit crinem capitis sui, et imposuit mitram super comam suam, et ornavit se vestimento jucunditatis suæ.
verses.english: And she took a small bottle of fine olive oil and anointed herself with the very best perfume. She carefully styled her hair and then placed a decorative headdress over it, adorning herself with her most joyful and festive clothing.

verses.latin: Et calceamenta pedum ejus posuit ad pedes suos, et armillas, et virgas, et anulos, et inaures, et omnem ornatum suum composuit.
verses.english: She put her sandals on her feet, and arranged all her jewelry: her bracelets, her bangles, her rings, her earrings, and every other adornment she possessed.

verses.latin: Et nimis bona erat specie, ut falleret oculos omnium virorum qui aspicerent illam.
verses.english: She was exceedingly beautiful in appearance, designed to captivate and deceive the eyes of all the men who would gaze upon her.

verses.latin: Et dedit ancillæ suæ ut omnia vasa sparsi panis acciperet, et vinum, et hydriam aquæ, et ciborum cocti pulveris: et totum victum suum, quem sanctificaverat, imposuit illi ferendum.
verses.english: And she instructed her maidservant to take all the vessels containing her carefully prepared bread, and her wine, and her water jar, and her pulverized, cooked food. She had set aside all her provisions, which she had sanctified for herself and for her mission, and she loaded them onto the maidservant to carry.

verses.latin: Et exierunt ambo simul civitate, ut venirent ad castra Assyriorum.
verses.english: And they both went out of the city together, so they could travel to the camp of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Cumque pervenissent ad portas civitatis, obviavit illis Ozias, et seniores civitatis Chabris et Charmis.
verses.english: And when they reached the city gates, Uzziah, and the elders of the city, Chabris and Charmis, met them there.

verses.latin: Et videntes eam, mutati sunt in stuporem, et obstupefacti sunt pulchritudinis ejus.
verses.english: And when they saw her, they were struck with profound astonishment, and they were utterly overwhelmed by her beauty.

verses.latin: Nihilominus tamen quod sciebant intentionem ejus, cohortati sunt eam, et dixerunt: Vadat Dominus in virtute sua tecum, et omne quod habes in animo, faciat tibi Dominus, ut gloria sit filiis Israël, et ad exaltationem Jerusalem.
verses.english: Nevertheless, because they understood her true intention and the mission she was undertaking, they encouraged her, and said: "May the Lord go with you in His divine strength, and may the Lord accomplish everything you have in your heart and mind to do, so that there may be glory for the children of Israel, and exaltation for Jerusalem."

verses.latin: Et adorans Judith Dominum, dixit: Amen, amen.
verses.english: And Judith, adoring the Lord, responded: "Amen, amen."

verses.latin: Et permansit in eodem loco, habens caput velatum, et rogabat Dominum.
verses.english: And she remained in that same place for a moment, keeping her head veiled as was customary for prayer, and she prayed to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et profecta est cum ancilla sua per montem, in quo erat aqua.
verses.english: And she set out with her maidservant, traveling through the mountain area, where there was a spring of fresh water.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad præsidia Assyriorum, et occurrerunt illis custodes.
verses.english: And they arrived at the Assyrian outposts, where the guards immediately met them.

verses.latin: Et comprehendentes eam, interrogabant, Dic, unde es? et unde venis? aut quo vadis?
verses.english: And seizing her, the guards began to question her: "Tell us, where are you from? And where are you coming from right now? Or where are you going?"

verses.latin: Et dixit illis: De filiabus sum Chanaan, et fugio a facie mea, quoniam futura est vobis in prædam.
verses.english: And she said to them: "I am from the daughters of Canaan—meaning, a Gentile woman from outside Israel—and I am fleeing from a terrible fate, for I know that my people are about to become your prey."

verses.latin: Et cum pervenisset ad præsidium principum, dixerunt, Apprehendite eam, et ducite ad Holofernem.
verses.english: And when she had been brought to the outpost where the commanders were stationed, they said, "Take her and lead her to Holofernes immediately."

verses.latin: Et venerunt, et venerunt ad tabernaculum Holofernis.
verses.english: And so they came, and they arrived at Holofernes' personal tent.

verses.latin: Et deduxerunt eam ad Holofernem, et stetit ante faciem ejus.
verses.english: And they led her directly to Holofernes, and she stood before his presence.

verses.latin: Et obtinuit Juditha verbum in tabernaculo Holofernis.
verses.english: And Judith managed to speak with Holofernes inside his tent.

verses.latin: Et Holofernes interrogavit eam, Dic mihi, de quo populo es tu? et unde venis?
verses.english: And Holofernes questioned her, saying: "Tell me, from what people are you? And from where do you come?"

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Ego sum ex filiabus Israël, et fugio a facie illorum, quoniam futura sunt in prædam.
verses.english: And Judith said: "I am from the daughters of Israel, and I am fleeing from them, because they are about to become your prey."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, ego sum ex servis tuis, et in diebus meis, non erit mihi malum in manu tua.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, I am truly one of your servants, and during my stay, no harm will come to me at your hand."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes replied again: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, audite sermonem meum, et non erit tibi malum in diebus meis.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, please listen to my words, and no harm will come to you during my days here."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes repeated: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, audite sermonem meum, et non erit tibi malum in diebus meis.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, listen to my words, and no harm will come to you during my days here."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said again: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Holofernes: Unde scis, quod futura sint in prædam?
verses.english: And Holofernes then asked: "From where do you know, that they are destined to become prey?"

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, ego sum ex servis tuis, et non est mihi malum in manu tua.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, I am one of your servants, and no harm has come to me at your hand thus far."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, ego sum ex servis tuis, et non est mihi malum in manu tua.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, I am one of your servants, and no harm has come to me at your hand thus far."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, ego sum ex servis tuis, et non est mihi malum in manu tua.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, I am one of your servants, and no harm has come to me at your hand thus far."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, ego sum ex servis tuis, et non est mihi malum in manu tua.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, I am one of your servants, and no harm has come to me at your hand thus far."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Et dixit Juditha: Domine mi, ego sum ex servis tuis, et non est mihi malum in manu tua.
verses.english: And Judith said: "My Lord, I am one of your servants, and no harm has come to me at your hand thus far."

verses.latin: Et Holofernes dixit: In diebus tuis, non erit tibi malum in manu mea.
verses.english: And Holofernes said: "For the duration of your stay, no harm will come to you at my hand."

verses.latin: Tunc Holofernes dixit ad eam: Consolamini, mulier, et noli timere corde tuo: quoniam ego nemini nocui, qui voluit servire Nabuchodonosor regi.
verses.english: Then Holofernes said to her: "Be comforted, woman, and do not fear in your heart. For I have never harmed anyone who truly wanted to serve King Nabuchodonosor."

verses.latin: Et si exercitus tuus non despiceret me, non elevabam manum meam in illum.
verses.english: "If your people's army had not disrespected me, I would not have raised my hand against them."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo dic mihi, propter quam causam aufugisti ab illis, et venisti ad nos?
verses.english: "Now therefore, tell me, for what reason did you flee from them and come to us?"

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Judith: Accipe verba ancillæ tuæ: quoniam si audieris verba ancillæ tuæ, perficiet Dominus tecum rem, quam non derelinquet in sempiternum gentem hanc, ut visitet te.
verses.english: And Judith said to him: "Listen to the words of your servant, because if you heed my words, the Lord will accomplish with you a deed that He will never abandon, so that He may bring His judgment upon this people through you."

verses.latin: Vivit enim Nabuchodonosor rex terræ, et vivit virtus ejus, quæ est in te, ad correptionem omnis animæ viventis: quia non solum hominibus serviunt illum, sed et bestiæ agri obediunt illi.
verses.english: "For as King Nabuchodonosor, the ruler of the earth, lives, and as his power lives — that power which resides in you for the punishment of every living soul — not only do men serve him, but even the wild beasts of the field obey him."

verses.latin: Sed et virtutem animi tui nobis est prædicandum, domine: quoniam hæc est per universas gentes nuntiata, quod tu solus bonus es in universo regno ejus, et potens in virtute, et singularis in consilio.
verses.english: "Indeed, the strength of your spirit must also be proclaimed to us, master. For this is announced throughout all nations: that you alone are truly good in his entire kingdom, mighty in power, and unique in counsel."

verses.latin: Nec verba tua quisquam despiciat: sed potius, qui derelinqueret te, gloriam nominis sui non haberet.
verses.english: "And let no one despise your words. Rather, whoever would abandon you would not possess the glory of their own name."

verses.latin: Sciat enim veritas regis Nabuchodonosor, et ejus virtus, quoniam omnis terra tuis viribus deservit.
verses.english: "For let the truth be known to King Nabuchodonosor and his power: that the entire land serves your might."

verses.latin: Sed et quod de te audivi, et de sapientia prudentiæ tuæ, nec ab omnibus in universa terra dignum est, ut detrahatur.
verses.english: "Indeed, what I have heard about you and about your prudent wisdom should not be diminished by anyone throughout the entire land."

verses.latin: Quoniam tu es solus bonus in universo regno: et potens in virtute, et mirabilis in consilio.
verses.english: "Because you alone are truly good in the entire kingdom, mighty in power, and admirable in counsel."

verses.latin: Sed neque, ut in vanum loquar, verum est hoc, quod locuta est ancilla tua ad faciem tuam: quoniam de Deo Israel cognovit mulier ancilla tua, quia tradet illum Deus in manu tua.
verses.english: "But let me not speak in vain. What your servant has spoken to your face is true, because your servant, a mere woman, has learned from the God of Israel that God will hand them over into your power."

verses.latin: Quoniam peccaverunt illi ad Dominum Deum suum, et non est in eis qui propugnet, nisi hoc, ut avertatur iram faciei illius a se.
verses.english: "Because they have sinned against the Lord their God, and there is no one among them who can defend them, unless it is to turn away His wrath from themselves."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, domine mi, ut verbum istud ad audientiam tuam veniat, si est in civitate illa falsum, ecce, ego dicam tibi hoc, quod non mentiar ad faciem tuam.
verses.english: "Now therefore, my master, let this word come to your hearing: if there is any falsehood or sin within that city, behold, I will tell you, and I will not lie to your face."

verses.latin: Et in omnibus his, quæ dixi, non mentietur ancilla tua, nec erit mendax.
verses.english: "And in all these things that I have said, your servant will not lie, nor will she be false."

verses.latin: Sed et si es in eo ut facias quod est verum, et quod est jus, et non dimittas illa, ego te non dimittam in omnes dies, nec non et in noctes, et in annos tuæ vitæ, et in omnes dies et noctes, quibus vivit virtus mea.
verses.english: "But if you are indeed inclined to do what is true and just, and do not abandon those principles, I will never abandon you throughout all the days and nights and years of your life, for as long as my strength endures."

verses.latin: Et exierimus in noctem per portam in vallem, et ambulabo in valle per omnem noctem: et veniem ad te in die, et nuntiabo tibi in qua re peccaverunt ad Deum meum.
verses.english: "And we will go out at night through the gate into the valley, and I will walk in the valley all through the night. Then I will come to you in the daytime and announce to you in what specific way they have sinned against my God."

verses.latin: Et scietis quoniam ascendet mihi Dominus ex Israel, ad visum, et ad audientiam, et ad omne opus meum: et cognoscet Dominus, quia non est in civitate hujus hominis nisi solum in eo.
verses.english: "And you will know that the Lord will guide me from among Israel, in what I see and hear and in all my work. And the Lord will know that there is nothing in this city that truly belongs to these people, except for their own lives—meaning no divine protection remains for them."

verses.latin: Et revertar iterum ad te in die illa, et narrabo tibi, quemadmodum transibunt contra omnia præcepta, quae constituit Deus illis, ut non manducent de fructibus frumenti, et de vino, et de oleo.
verses.english: "And I will return to you again on that day and tell you how they will transgress all the precepts that God has commanded them, that they should not eat from the grain, or the wine, or the oil."

verses.latin: Et hæc facient in magna necessitate, ut accipiant omnia ista, et immineant comedere, et incipiant peccare ad Deum eorum: et veniet tibi nuntius, et ego nuntiabo tibi, quemadmodum transibunt contra omnia præcepta, quae constituit Deus illis, ut non manducent de fructibus frumenti, et de vino, et de oleo.
