verses.english: "And they will do these things out of great necessity, to obtain all these supplies. They will be compelled to eat them and begin to sin against their God. Then a message will come to you, and I will personally announce to you how they will transgress all the precepts that God has commanded them, concerning not eating from the grain, or the wine, or the oil."

verses.latin: Et in omnibus istis, ego tibi nuntiabo omnia, et tradam tibi illos, et omnem provinciam Judææ, et in medio Hierusalem.
verses.english: "And in all these matters, I will announce everything to you and hand them over to you—and all the province of Judea, and the very middle of Jerusalem."

verses.latin: Et dixit Holofernes ad eam: Benædixit te Dominus Deus tuus, quoniam ad nos mittit te, ut glorificetur virtus nostra in medio omnium, qui habitant terram.
verses.english: And Holofernes said to her: "May the Lord your God bless you, because He sends you to us, so that our power may be glorified among all who inhabit the land."

verses.latin: Et mulier, sermo tuus bonus est, et non est in terra, qui tecum comparetur.
verses.english: "And woman, your speech is good, and there is no one in the land who can compare with you."

verses.latin: Sed et virtus tua, et sapientia cordis tui, mirabilis est: ut venias ad nos, et narres hæc.
verses.english: "Indeed, your strength and the wisdom of your heart are wonderful, in that you have come to us and related these things."

verses.latin: Holophernes autem dixit illi: Confortare, et noli timere in corde tuo: quia nunquam nocui viro, qui voluit servire Nabuchodonosor regi universae terrae.
verses.english: Holofernes spoke to her, saying, “Take courage and do not be afraid in your heart. I have never harmed any man who willingly served Nebuchadnezzar, the king of all the earth.”

verses.latin: Et si populus tuus non contemnisset Deum meum, non levassem lanceam meam super illos: sed ipsi sibi ista fecerunt.
verses.english: “If your people had not shown contempt for my god,” he continued, “I would not have raised my spear against them. But they themselves have brought these consequences upon themselves.”

verses.latin: Nunc autem dic mihi, unde fugisti ab illis, et quare venisti ad nos? Salvus enim esse debes: confortare, et vive hac nocte et deinceps.
verses.english: “Now, tell me: from where have you fled from them, and why have you come to us? You are meant to be safe. Therefore, take courage and live through this night and hereafter.”

verses.latin: Nemo enim te laedet: sed bene te facient omnes, sicut et ministros meos.
verses.english: “Indeed, no one will harm you. Instead, everyone will treat you well, just as they treat my own servants.”

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Judith: Suscipe verba ancillae tuae: quoniam si secutus fueris verba ancillae tuae, perficiet Dominus in te rem: et non disperdet consilia tua.
verses.english: Judith replied to him, “Receive the words of your handmaid. For if you follow the counsel of your servant, the Lord will bring this matter to a perfect conclusion through you, and He will not frustrate your plans.”

verses.latin: Vivit enim Nabuchodonosor rex terrae, et virtus ejus quae est in te ad correptionem omnis animae viventis: quoniam non solum homines per te serviunt illi, sed et bestiae agri per te subjacent illi.
verses.english: “As surely as Nebuchadnezzar, the king of the earth, lives, and as truly as his power—which resides in you for the chastisement of every living soul—is real: not only do people serve him through you, but even the wild beasts of the field are subjected to him through your command.”

verses.latin: Sed vetera magis Assyriae confirmant per virtutem tuam potentiam Dei, et non recedet vagus ab eo.
verses.english: “Rather, the ancient traditions of Assyria are now fulfilled through your might, confirming the power of your god. No one who wanders from his path will escape.”

verses.latin: Audivimus enim sapientiam tuam et prudentiam tuam, et nuntiatum est omni terra quod tu solus sis bonus in omni regno, et potens in omni disciplina.
verses.english: “For we have heard of your wisdom and your prudence. It has been reported throughout all the land that you alone are truly excellent in all the king's dominion, powerful in every military discipline.”

verses.latin: Nec mirum est quoniam tu solus es bonus, qui servias Nabuchodonosor regi universae terrae, et ipse te misit ut omnem terram reformes.
verses.english: “And it is no wonder that you alone are so excellent, since you serve Nebuchadnezzar, the king of all the earth, and he himself has sent you to bring order and reform to the entire world.”

verses.latin: Nam et hoc, quod audivimus, loquimur: quod probatum est, quia Judaei non comedunt sanguinem, nec suffocatum animal, nec immundum quidquam: sed sunt abstinentes ab his cibis longo tempore.
verses.english: “For this also, which we have heard, we speak of: it has been proven true that the Jewish people do not eat blood, nor an animal that has been strangled, nor anything unclean. Indeed, they have abstained from these foods for a very long time.”

verses.latin: Itaque ego ancilla tua, cogitans haec omnia, dixi intra me: Vadam ad dominum meum Holophernem, et enuntiabo illi omnia secreta eorum, et demonstrabo illi per quam viam possit eos capere, absque ullo detrimento exercitus sui.
verses.english: “Therefore, I, your handmaid, pondering all these things, said within myself: 'I will go to my lord Holofernes and reveal to him all their secrets. I will show him by what means he can capture them all, without any detriment to his army.'”

verses.latin: Rebellarunt enim contra te, et pleni sunt iniquitatibus, et ira Domini provocata est in illis.
verses.english: “For they have rebelled against you, and they are full of iniquities, and the wrath of my Lord has been provoked against them.”

verses.latin: Praeterea quoniam defecerunt eis cibi, et omnis aqua ipsorum jam defecit, cogitaverunt aggredi pecora sua, et ea quae non licet eis comedere, jam statuerunt comedere: et sanguinem, et suffocata, et immunda comedere constituerunt.
verses.english: “Furthermore, because their food supplies have failed them and all their water has now run out, they have decided to attack their livestock. And what they are not permitted to eat, they have now resolved to consume: they have determined to eat blood, and animals that have been strangled, and other unclean things.”

verses.latin: Et miserunt de Jerusalem, quia habitantes ibi fecerunt haec, ut afferrent eis omnes fructus, et vinum, et oleum terrae, quae sanctificaverant: et constituerunt adducere ea in locum mundum, et ibi consumere.
verses.english: “They have even sent word to Jerusalem—because the inhabitants there have committed these very transgressions—for them to bring all the consecrated fruits, wine, and oil from the land. They have arranged to bring these provisions to a ritually clean place and consume them there.”

verses.latin: Et sciens haec, scio quod quando incipierint haec facere, dabuntur tibi in interitum: et non opus erit pugnare, sed sine ullo bello ducam te ad omnem multitudinem ad pedes tuos.
verses.english: “And knowing these things, I know that when they begin to do these forbidden acts, they will be given into your hands for utter destruction. You will not need to engage in battle, but without a single fight, I will lead you to bring the entire multitude to your feet.”

verses.latin: Et ego ancilla tua, sciens haec, fugi ab illis, et misit me Dominus haec nuntiare tibi.
verses.english: “And I, your handmaid, knowing all this, fled from them. The Lord has sent me to report these very things to you.”

verses.latin: Et ancilla tua colit Deum nocte ac die, et egrediar in vallem, et orabo ad Dominum: et dicet mihi quando committant haec peccata.
verses.english: “And your handmaid worships God day and night. I will go out into the valley and pray to the Lord, and He will tell me when they commit these specific sins.”

verses.latin: Et veniens nuntiabo tibi, et tunc perges cum omni exercitu tuo, et non erit qui resistat tibi.
verses.english: “Then, upon returning, I will inform you, and at that time you shall advance with your entire army, and there will be no one able to resist you.”

verses.latin: Et audiens Holophernes verba ejus cum gaudio, et servientes ejus admirabantur sapientiam ejus, et dicebant:
verses.english: Holofernes listened to her words with joy, and his servants were astonished by her wisdom. They spoke among themselves, saying:

verses.latin: Non est talis mulier super terram, ab uno fine usque ad alium, specie et sapientia.
verses.english: “There is no such woman upon the earth, from one end to the other, in both beauty and wisdom.”

verses.latin: Dixit autem ad illam Holophernes: Bene fecit Deus, qui te misit ante populum tuum, ut possit per manus tuas tribui nobis victoria.
verses.english: Then Holofernes said to her, “God has done well to send you ahead of your people, so that victory might be delivered into our hands through you.”

verses.latin: Et quoniam bona sunt verba tua, et pulchra facies tua: ita eris salva in domo mea, et non deficiet tibi panis et vinum.
verses.english: “And because your words are excellent, and your face is beautiful, you shall be safe in my household. You will never lack bread or wine.”

verses.latin: Sed mane apud me, et nullus te laedet: sed sicut et ministros meos, ita te facient.
verses.english: “Instead, you shall remain here with me, and no one will harm you. They will treat you just as they treat my own servants.”

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Judith: Non possum comedere ex his quae jussisti dari mihi, ne fiat offensio.
verses.english: Judith replied to him, “I cannot eat from the provisions you have commanded to be given to me, lest I commit an offense against God and transgress His law.”

verses.latin: Sed de his quae mihi attuli, manducabo: aut si vis ut patiar egestatem, comedam de tuis.
verses.english: “Instead, I will eat from the provisions I have brought with me. Or, if you truly wish for me to suffer deprivation, then I will eat from your supplies.”

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Holophernes: Quid si defecerint tibi ea quae attulisti, tecum commoranti?
verses.english: Holofernes then asked her, “What if the provisions you have brought with you run out while you are staying with us?”

verses.latin: Magna enim est via, et longo tempore non potes venire ad civitatem.
verses.english: “For the journey is long, and for a long time, you will not be able to return to your city.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Vivit anima tua, domine mi, quia non expendam omnia quae attuli mecum, donec perficiat Dominus per manus meas haec quae statui.
verses.english: Judith replied, “As your soul lives, my lord, I will not consume all the provisions I have brought with me, until the Lord accomplishes through my hand the purpose I have set out to achieve.”

verses.latin: Et duxerunt servi Holophernis eam in tabernaculum ejus, et dormivit illic.
verses.english: Then Holofernes’ servants led her into her tent, and she rested there.

verses.latin: Et surrexit ante lucem, et praecepit ancillae suae ut praepararet ei cibos suos puros, sicut consueverat.
verses.english: And she rose early, before dawn, and commanded her handmaid to prepare her ritually pure food, as she was accustomed to do.

verses.latin: Et egressa est in vallem cum ancilla sua, et lavit se in fonte aquae.
verses.english: And she went out into the valley with her handmaid and bathed herself in the fountain of water.

verses.latin: Et cum surrexisset, oravit ad Dominum Deum Israel, ut dirigeret viam ejus ad liberationem populi sui.
verses.english: And when she had finished bathing and risen, she prayed to the Lord, the God of Israel, that He would direct her path toward the deliverance of her people.

verses.latin: Et ingressa manebat pura in tabernaculo, et manducabat cibos suos, usque ad diem quartum.
verses.english: Then she returned and remained ritually pure in her tent, eating her own provisions, until the fourth day.

verses.latin: Et in die quarta fecit Holophernes coenam servis suis, et neminem ex omnibus magistratibus invitavit, praeter solos qui erant in tabernaculo suo.
verses.english: And on the fourth day, Holofernes prepared a feast for his servants. He invited none of his officers, only those who were with him in his personal tent.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad Bagao eunuchum, qui erat praepositus omnibus rebus ejus: Vade, et persuade Hebraeae illi, ut sponte acquiescat commorari mecum, ut manducet et bibat nobiscum.
verses.english: And he said to Bagao, the eunuch who was in charge of all his affairs, “Go and persuade that Hebrew woman to willingly agree to stay with me, so that she may eat and drink with us.”

verses.latin: Turpe enim nobis est, si talem mulierem abire dimittamus, ut non colloquamur cum ea: si enim non potuerimus illam flectere, irridebit nos.
verses.english: “For it is a disgrace for us if we allow such a woman to leave without having had her company. Indeed, if we cannot sway her, she will mock us.”

verses.latin: Et ingressus est Bagao ad Judith, et dixit: Ne timeat domina mea intrare ad dominum meum, ut honorificetur coram illo, et manducet, et bibat cum illo, et jucundetur: quia haec dies est sicut dies festus tibi.
verses.english: Then Bagao went in to Judith and said, “Let my lady not be afraid to enter my lord's presence, so that she may be honored before him and eat and drink with him, and be merry. For this day will be like a feast day for you.”

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Judith: Quis sum ego, ut contradicam domino meo? Omne quod placuerit illi, faciam: et hoc erit bonum coram oculis ejus.
verses.english: Judith replied to him, “Who am I to contradict my lord? I will do everything that pleases him, and whatever is good in his sight.”

verses.latin: Et exsurgens Judith ornavit se vestimentis suis, et posuit omnem ornatum suum muliebrem. Et praecedens ancilla ejus extendit ante faciem Holophernis velum, quod sibi comparaverat a Bagao in die qua se recepit: et sedit Holophernes super pulvinar ejus, ex purpura, et auro, et smaragdo, et lapidibus pretiosis compositum.
verses.english: Judith arose and dressed herself in her finest garments, putting on all her feminine adornments. Her handmaid went before her and spread the beautiful veil, which Judith had acquired from Bagao on the day she was received, before Holofernes. Holofernes himself was sitting upon his splendid cushion, fashioned from purple fabric, gold, emeralds, and other precious stones.

verses.latin: Et cum introisset Judith, concussum est cor Holophernis, valde in aspectu ejus. Et plenus est cupidine ad eam concumbendi, non enim viderat mulierem talem a diebus vitae suae.
verses.english: And when Judith entered, Holofernes’ heart was deeply stirred by her appearance. He was filled with an overwhelming desire to lie with her, for he had never seen such a woman in all his life.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque illi Achior: Audi domine mi verbum ex ore servi tui, et referam tibi veritatem de populo hoc, qui vicinus est tibi, et habitat in his montibus: et non mendacium loquar in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: So Achior said to him: 'Hear, my lord, a true word from the mouth of your servant. I will tell you the truth about this people who live as neighbors to you and inhabit these mountains. I will not speak a lie in your presence.'

verses.latin: Populus iste descendit ex Chaldæis.
verses.english: This people descended from the Chaldeans —meaning, their ancestor Abraham was called out of Ur of the Chaldeans by God.

verses.latin: Et manserunt illic in adventu eorum in Mesopotamiam, quoniam noluerunt sequi deos patrum suorum, qui erant in terra Chaldæorum.
verses.english: When they first came into Mesopotamia, they stayed there for a time, because they refused to follow the idolatrous gods of their ancestors who were in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Et declinaverunt de via patrum suorum, et adoraverunt Deum cæli, Deum quem cognoverunt.
verses.english: They turned away from the ways of their idolatrous fathers and worshipped the one true God of the universe, the God whom they truly knew.

verses.latin: Et ejecerunt eos a faciebus deorum suorum: et fugerunt in Mesopotamiam, et habitaverunt illic dies multos.
verses.english: Because of this, others cast them out from the presence of their gods. So, they fled into Mesopotamia and lived there for many days.

verses.latin: Et illinc migraverunt in terram Chanaan, et habitaverunt super eam, et multiplicati sunt auri et argenti, et nimis immenso numero pecorum.
verses.english: From there, they migrated to the land of Canaan and lived upon it. They grew rich with gold and silver and an exceedingly immense number of livestock.

verses.latin: Et descendentes in Ægyptum, cum oppressi essent a rege Pharaone, fecerunt clamaverunt ad Deum suum, et percusit universam terram Ægypti plagis variis.
verses.english: Later, when they went down into Egypt and were oppressed by King Pharaoh, they cried out to their God. In response, He struck the entire land of Egypt with various plagues.

verses.latin: Et ejecit illos Deus de terra Ægypti, et fecit separationem inter ipsos et Ægyptios.
verses.english: And God cast them out of the land of Egypt and made a clear separation between them and the Egyptians —at the Red Sea.

verses.latin: Et siccavit mare rubrum ante eos, et deduxit illos in via deserti Cades Barne usque ad finem orbis terræ.
verses.english: He dried up the Red Sea before them and led them on a path through the desert of Kadesh-Barnea, even to the farthest known parts of the world.

verses.latin: Et habitaverunt in terra Amorrhæi trans Jordanem in deserto usque in Idumæam, et in monte Gabaa, et in omnem terram Gesen usque illuc.
verses.english: They lived in the land of the Amorites beyond the Jordan in the desert, stretching as far as Edom, and on Mount Gilead, and throughout all the land of Goshen, even to those distant regions.

verses.latin: Et postquam peccaverunt in conspectu Dei sui, et commoti sunt in vias suas, secundum quod fecissent multæ nationes: dejecit illos a facie sua, et tradidit in rapinam inimicis suis.
verses.english: But after they sinned in the sight of their God, and they departed from His ways, acting like many other nations do, He cast them away from His presence and delivered them to be plundered by their enemies.

verses.latin: Et traducti sunt in Babyloniam, ubi manserunt annis multis.
verses.english: They were led away into Babylonia, where they remained for many years in exile.

verses.latin: Et postea conversi sunt ad Deum suum, et reduxit illos de Babylonia, et restituit illos in terram suam, et iterum possederunt illam.
verses.english: Afterwards, they returned to their God, and He brought them back from Babylonia and restored them to their own land, and they possessed it once again.

verses.latin: Et nunc ipsi inhabitant in montibus, et habent in illis civitates et pagos multos.
verses.english: And now they themselves live in these mountains, and they have many cities and villages within them.

verses.latin: Præter hæc, quia non peccaverunt in conspectu Dei sui, secundum mores nationum, quæ non sunt in conspectu tuo: nunc etiamsi non peccaverunt, et non fecerunt contra Deum suum quod faciunt alii populi: propterea, etiamsi non peccaverunt, nec sunt in conspectu tuo, non est potestas tua ut illis noceas.
verses.english: Furthermore, because they have not sinned in the sight of their God according to the customs of the other nations you have seen, even if they have not sinned and have not acted against their God as other peoples do— therefore, if they have not sinned, nor are they without His protection, your power cannot harm them.

verses.latin: Sed si peccaverint in conspectu Dei sui, tu potes eos in teipsum assumere.
verses.english: But if they have sinned in the sight of their God, then you can subdue them for yourself.

verses.latin: Et ut scias quia vera sunt quæ dico, aut quando non fuerint peccatores in conspectu Dei sui, non sunt tibi in impedimento, sed in prælio et in cæde.
verses.english: And so that you may know that what I say is true, consider that when they have not been sinners in the sight of their God, they have not been an obstacle to you, but rather they have been victorious in battle and in slaughter.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo domine mi, et rex, et potestas orbis terræ: si est aliqua iniquitas in populo hoc in conspectu Dei sui, detrahe eos, ut possim ascendere et persequi, et vincere illos.
verses.english: Therefore, my lord, O king, and mighty ruler of the earth: if there is any iniquity in this people in the sight of their God, then destroy them, so that I may advance, pursue, and conquer them.

verses.latin: Si autem non est offensa in populo isto, cave tibi, ne resistas contra Deum suum, ne teipsum dejicias, quoniam Deus eorum est protector, et ipse est qui illos protegit.
verses.english: However, if there is no offense in this people, then beware lest you resist against their God, lest you bring ruin upon yourself. For their God is their protector, and He it is who shelters them.

verses.latin: Et factum est cum Achior finisset hæc verba, iratus est Holofernes ad Achior valde, et dixit ad illum: Quis es tu, Achior, quod prophetizas nobis quasi Deus Israel?
verses.english: And it happened that when Achior had finished speaking these words, Holofernes became very angry with Achior and said to him: 'Who are you, Achior, that you dare to prophesy to us as if you were the God of Israel?'

verses.latin: Propter hoc autem, quia dixisti nobis quod si peccaverit populus Israel, nos possimus eos vincere: nunc ergo, ut scias quia falsum est quod dixisti, ego teipsum tradam in manus eorum.
verses.english: 'But because you told us that if the people of Israel have sinned, we can conquer them— now then, so that you may know that what you have said is false, I myself will deliver you into their hands!'

verses.latin: Et videbis quoniam in teipsum non poteris effugere mortem, sed moriendum est tibi in præsentia eorum.
verses.english: 'And you will see that you yourself will not be able to escape death; instead, you must die in their presence!'

verses.latin: Et cum tulerimus eos in captivitatem, vel cæperimus, tunc tu, ut scias quia Deus es eorum, morieris cum illis.
verses.english: 'And when we have taken them captive, or captured their land, then you, so that you may know that you are their God, will die with them!'

verses.latin: Præcepit itaque Holofernes ut introducerent eam ubi erant reposita vasa argentea Holofernis, et statuit illi de cibis suis, ut manducaret, et de vino suo ut biberet.
verses.english: So Holofernes gave orders that Judith should be brought to the place where Holofernes’ personal silverware was stored. He set out some of his own food for her to eat and some of his own wine for her to drink.

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Non comedam ex his, ne fiat offensa, sed ex his quæ allata sunt mihi, comedam.
verses.english: But Judith said, 'I will not eat any of these things, lest I commit an offense. Instead, I will eat only from the food that I brought with me.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Holofernes: Si defecerint hæc quæ tecum sunt, unde dabimus tibi similia? Nos enim non habemus tecum morantes de genere tuo.
verses.english: Holofernes asked her, 'If the provisions you brought run out, where will we find more food like them for you? For there is no one from your own people living among us here.'

verses.latin: Et dixit illi Judith: Vivo Domine, quoniam non deficiet cibus meus per hanc viam quam veni, donec faciat Dominus per me hæc quæ cogitavi.
verses.english: Judith answered him, 'As the Lord lives, my food will not run out during this journey I have undertaken, until the Lord accomplishes through me what I have planned to do.'

verses.latin: Et introduxerunt illam famuli ejus in tabernaculum ipsius, et dormivit usque in mediam noctem: et paulo ante lucanum primam surrexit.
verses.english: So Holofernes’ servants brought her into her own tent, and she slept until midnight. She arose a short while before the first dawn.

verses.latin: Et mandavit ad Holofernem, dicens: Præcipiat dominus meus ut dimittant me ancillam suam ut oram, et ex eo cibum capiam et potum.
verses.english: Then she sent a message to Holofernes, saying, 'My lord, please give orders that your servant be permitted to go out for prayer, and from there I will take my food and drink.'

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo Holofernes ut non prohiberent illam. Mansit itaque in castris per dies tres, et exiebat in noctibus foras in vallem Bethuliæ, et lavabatur in fonte aquæ in castris.
verses.english: Holofernes therefore gave orders that they should not stop her. So she stayed in the camp for three days, and each night she would go out into the valley of Bethulia and bathe herself in the spring of water that was within the camp.

verses.latin: Et ut ascendebat, orabat Dominum Deum Israël, ut dirigeret viam ejus ad liberationem populi sui.
verses.english: And as she returned from bathing, she would pray to the Lord God of Israel that He would direct her path towards the liberation of His people.

verses.latin: Et introeuntem mundam, manebat in tabernaculo suo per dies singulos, donec adveniret hora qua cibum caperet.
verses.english: After returning purified, she would remain in her tent each day, until the hour came for her to eat her food.

verses.latin: Et in die quarta fecit Holofernes cœnam servis suis, et dixit ad Vagao eunuchum suum: Vade, et suade Judææ illi ut sponte veniat ut manducet et bibat apud nos.
verses.english: On the fourth day, Holofernes prepared a feast for his servants. Then he said to Bagoas, his eunuch, 'Go and persuade that Jewess to come willingly to eat and drink with us.'

verses.latin: Quia turpe est, inquit, si tam magna spernat mulier virum, ut non loquatur cum eo. Si enim non vocaverimus illam, deridebit nos.
verses.english: He continued, 'For it would be shameful if so great a woman were to scorn a man by refusing to speak with him. If we do not invite her, she will surely mock us.'

verses.latin: Abiit itaque Vagao a facie Holofernis, et introivit ad eam, et ait: Non pigeat bonam puellam intrare ad dominum nostrum, ut honorificetur coram illo, et bibat nobiscum vinum in jucunditate.
verses.english: So Bagoas went from Holofernes' presence and entered Judith’s tent. He said, 'Do not hesitate, my good lady, to come before our master, so that you may be honored in his presence and drink wine with us in merriment.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum Judith: Quæ sum ego, ut contradicam domino meo? Quicquid utile est ante oculos ejus, hoc faciam velociter.
verses.english: Judith answered him, 'Who am I to contradict my master? Whatever is pleasing in his sight, I will do it quickly.'

verses.latin: Et exsurgens ornavit se vestimento suo, et omnibus mundis muliebribus, et praecessit eam ancilla ejus ut ostenderet Holoferni, quemadmodum introeuntem ad se suscipere deberet.
verses.english: And rising, she adorned herself with her finest garments and all her feminine ornaments. Her maidservant went ahead of her to show Holofernes how he should receive her as she entered his presence.

verses.latin: Cumque introisset Judith, et recubuisset, Holofernes conturbatus est in anima sua, et concitatus in spiritu, factus est cupidus valde ejus, concupiscens eam ex tempore quo primum vidit illam.
verses.english: When Judith entered and reclined at the table, Holofernes was deeply troubled in his spirit and stirred with strong desire. He became exceedingly lustful for her, coveting her from the very first moment he saw her.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eam Holofernes: Bibe, et jocundare nobiscum.
verses.english: Then Holofernes said to her, 'Drink, and be merry with us!'

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Bibam, domine mi, quoniam magnificata est anima mea hodie præ omnibus diebus meis.
verses.english: Judith replied, 'I will drink, my lord, for my spirit is exalted this day above all my previous days.'

verses.latin: Et accepit et manducavit et bibit coram illo, quæ paraverat ancilla ejus.
verses.english: And she took the food and drink her maidservant had prepared for her, and she ate and drank in his presence.

verses.latin: Et jucundatus est Holofernes ad eam, et bibit vinum multum nimis, quantum nunquam biberat in vita sua.
verses.english: Holofernes was greatly delighted with her, and he drank an excessive amount of wine, more than he had ever drunk in his entire life.

verses.latin: Et jussit Holofernes ut introducerent eam quo erat thesaurus ejus, et jussit ut cibos de suis et vinum biberet.
verses.english: Then Holofernes commanded that Judith be led to the place where his treasures were kept, and he also ordered that she should eat his own food and drink his own wine.

verses.latin: Et respondit Judith: Non comedam ex his, ne fiat mihi offensa: sed ex his quae adlata sunt mihi ex Judæa, comedam.
verses.english: And Judith answered him: "I will not eat any of these things, so that I may not commit a sin against God. Instead, I will eat from the provisions that I brought with me from Judea."

verses.latin: Et dixit Holofernes ad illam: Si defecerint tibi hæc quæ tecum adlata sunt, quid faciemus tibi?
verses.english: Holofernes then said to her: "If these provisions that you brought with you run out, what will we do for you then?"

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Vivit anima tua, domine mi, quoniam non expendet ancilla tua omnia hæc, donec faciat Deus in manu mea hæc quæ cogitavi. Et locuti sunt ad illam ministri Holofernis de nocte.
verses.english: Judith replied: "As your soul lives, my lord, your handmaid will not use up all of these provisions until God accomplishes through me what I have planned." After she said this, Holofernes's servants spoke to her about this matter throughout the night.

verses.latin: Et introivit ad cubiculum suum.
verses.english: Then Judith went into her own private chamber.

verses.latin: Et mansit in illis tribus diebus in castris, et in noctibus exiebat in vallem Bethuliæ, et lavabat se in fonte aquæ in castris.
verses.english: She stayed in the camp for three days. During the nights, she would go out into the valley of Bethulia and wash herself at a spring of water located within the camp.

verses.latin: Et cum ascendisset, orabat Dominum Deum Israël, ut dirigeret viam ejus ad liberationem populi sui.
verses.english: And when she returned, she would pray to the Lord, the God of Israel, asking Him to direct her path for the liberation of His people.

verses.latin: Et intrabat munda, et sic manebat in cubiculo suo, donec sumeret cibum ad vesperam.
verses.english: She would re-enter her chamber in a state of ritual cleanliness and would remain there until she ate her meal in the evening.

verses.latin: Et in quarta die Holofernes fecit convivium servis suis, et dixit ad Vagao eunuchum suum: Vade, et suade Hebrææ illi ut sponte veniat, et manducet et bibat mecum.
verses.english: On the fourth day, Holofernes prepared a feast for his servants. He then said to Bagoas, his chief eunuch: "Go and persuade that Hebrew woman to come of her own free will and eat and drink with me."

verses.latin: Dixit enim indignum esse, si talem fœminam haberet, ut non frueretur ea: quinimo si non adhibuisset eam, derisui esset Hebræis.
verses.english: For Holofernes believed it would be shameful for him to have such a woman in his camp and not enjoy her company. In fact, he thought that if he did not invite her, he would be ridiculed by the Hebrews themselves.

verses.latin: Et intravit Vagao ad Judith, et dixit: Non verearis, bona puella, intrare ad dominum meum, ut honoreris coram illo, ut manduces cum illo, et bibas vinum in lætitia.
verses.english: So Bagoas went to Judith and said: "Do not be afraid, good lady, to come to my lord. You will be honored in his presence, and you will eat with him and drink wine with joy."

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Quis sum ego, ut contradicam domino meo? Quidquid utile est in oculis ejus, hoc faciam statim: et erit mihi gaudium usque in diem mortis meæ.
verses.english: And Judith responded: "Who am I to contradict my lord? Whatever is pleasing in his eyes, I will do immediately. This will be a joy for me until the day of my death."

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et ornavit se vestimentis suis, et ingressa est, et stetit ante faciem ejus.
verses.english: So she rose and adorned herself in her finest garments. Then she entered and stood before Holofernes.

verses.latin: Et immittens Holofernes eam in cubile suum, ait illi: Bibe nunc, et epulare mecum, et jucundare.
verses.english: Holofernes had her brought onto his couch and said to her: "Drink now, and feast with me, and enjoy yourself."

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith: Bibam, domine, quoniam amplificata est anima mea in hac die super omnes dies meos.
verses.english: Judith replied: "I will drink, my lord, because my spirit has been lifted this day more than on any previous day of my life."

verses.latin: Et accepit, et manducavit et bibit coram illo, quæ præparaverat ancilla ejus ei.
verses.english: And she took the food and ate and drank before him from what her maidservant had prepared for her.

verses.latin: Et jucundatus est Holofernes in ea, et bibit vinum multum nimis, quantum nunquam biberat in vita sua.
verses.english: Holofernes was greatly pleased with her, and he drank an excessive amount of wine, more than he had ever drunk in his entire life.

verses.latin: Et cum sero esset factum, surrexit unusquisque de servis illius, et festinavit in hospitia sua: et clausit Vagao ostia cubiculi, et abiit.
verses.english: When evening arrived, each of his servants got up and hurried to their quarters. Then Bagoas closed the doors of the bedroom and left.

verses.latin: Et erant omnes fatigati a convivio, admodum Holofernes, et Judith sola erat in cubiculo.
verses.english: Everyone was exhausted from the feast, especially Holofernes. Only Judith remained alone in the bedroom with him.

verses.latin: Et cum esset Holofernes vino gravis, recubuit in lecto suo.
verses.english: When Holofernes was heavily intoxicated with wine, he lay down on his bed.

verses.latin: Et misit Judith ad ancillam suam ut staret foras ante cubiculum, et expectaret, donec exiret sicut consueverat in oratione sua.
verses.english: Judith sent word to her maidservant to stand outside the bedroom and wait until she came out, as she usually did for her prayers.

verses.latin: Dixit enim Judith, quod egredietur ad orationem suam, et nuntiavit Vagao.
verses.english: Judith had previously told Bagoas that she would go out for her prayers, and he had been informed.

verses.latin: Et cum abiissent omnes, et nemo esset a secreto usque ad minorem, stetit Judith juxta caput ejus orans cum lacrymis, et movens labia in silentio.
verses.english: After everyone had left and there was no one present, from the most trusted to the least important servant, Judith stood by Holofernes's head, praying with tears and moving her lips in silence.

verses.latin: Et dicens: Confirma me Domine Deus Israël, et respice in opera manuum mearum, ut sicut promisisti, possim perficere.
verses.english: And she said: "Strengthen me, Lord God of Israel, and look upon the work of my hands. Grant that I may accomplish what you have promised, just as you promised."

verses.latin: Et extraxit gladium Holofernis, qui erat sub cervicali ejus.
verses.english: Then she drew out Holofernes's sword, which was lying beneath his pillow.

verses.latin: Et apprehendens comam capitis ejus, dixit: Confirma me Domine Deus in hac hora.
verses.english: And grasping the hair of his head, she said: "Strengthen me, Lord God, in this very hour."

verses.latin: Et percussit bis in cervicem ejus, et abscidit caput ejus, et avulsit totum corpus ejus a capite, et abscondit illud sub conopeo.
verses.english: And she struck him twice on his neck, severing his head. She completely separated his body from his head and then concealed the head beneath his mosquito netting, which covered his bed.

verses.latin: Et exivit, et tradidit caput Holofernis ancillæ suæ, et jussit ut in sportam suam mitteret.
verses.english: She then went out and handed Holofernes's head to her maidservant, instructing her to put it into her provision basket.

verses.latin: Et exierunt ambo secundum consuetudinem suam, quasi ad orationem, et transierunt castra, et circuierunt vallem, et venerunt ad portam civitatis.
verses.english: Then both of them left the tent according to their usual routine, as if going out for prayer. They passed through the camp, circled the valley, and finally arrived at the gate of the city of Bethulia.

verses.latin: Et dixit Judith in longinquo custodibus murorum: Aperite portas, quoniam nobiscum est Deus, qui fecit virtutem in Israël.
verses.english: From a distance, Judith called out to the guards on the walls: "Open the gates, for God is with us, He who has shown great strength in Israel!"

verses.latin: Et cum audissent homines vocem ejus, festinaverunt ad portas civitatis, et vocaverunt majores natu civitatis.
verses.english: When the people heard her voice, they rushed to the city gates and summoned the elders of the city.

verses.latin: Et concurrerunt omnes a minimo usque ad maximum, quoniam sperabant eam jam non esse venturam.
verses.english: Everyone gathered, from the least to the greatest, because they had given up hope that she would ever return.

verses.latin: Et accendentes luminaria, aperuerunt eis: et susceperunt eos, et fecerunt lumen magnum in lætitia.
verses.english: And lighting their lamps, they opened the gates for them. They welcomed Judith and her maidservant, and a great light of joy shone forth.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis Judith: Laudate Dominum Deum nostrum, qui non deseruit sperantes in se.
verses.english: Then Judith said to them: "Praise the Lord our God, who has not abandoned those who hope in Him!"

verses.latin: Et in me ancilla sua adimplevit misericordiam suam, quam pollicitus est domui Israël, et per manum meam occidit principem inimicorum vestrorum.
verses.english: And through me, His handmaid, He has fulfilled His mercy, which He promised to the house of Israel. Through my hand, He has killed the leader of your enemies!

verses.latin: Et proferens de sporta caput Holofernis, ostendit illis, dicens: Ecce caput Holofernis principis militiæ Assyriorum, et ecce conopeum ejus, in quo recumbebat in ebrietate sua, ubi percussit illum Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: Then, drawing Holofernes's head from her basket, she showed it to them, saying: "Behold, the head of Holofernes, the commander of the Assyrian army! And behold his own mosquito netting, where he lay in his drunkenness, and where the Lord our God struck him down!"

verses.latin: Et humiliatum est os Altissimi, in manu fœminæ.
verses.english: And the mouth of the Most High God was humbled, by being defeated by the hand of a woman.

verses.latin: Tunc adorans omnis populus, Deum, et dicens: Benedictus es tu Domine, qui exterminasti inimicos tuos in hac die.
verses.english: Then all the people worshipped God, saying: "Blessed are You, O Lord, who have utterly destroyed your enemies on this very day!"

verses.latin: Et dixit Ozias princeps populi Israël ad Judith: Benedicta es tu, filia, a Domino Deo excelso super omnes mulieres super terram.
verses.english: And Ozias, the leader of the people of Israel, said to Judith: "Blessed are you, daughter, by the Lord, the most high God, above all women on the earth."

verses.latin: Benedictus Deus qui creavit cælum et terram, qui te direxit in vulnera capitis principis inimicorum nostrorum: quia hodie nomen tuum ita magnificavit, ut non recedat laus tua de ore hominum, qui memoriam fuerint virtutis Dei in æternum. Amen, amen.
verses.english: Blessed be God, who created the universe and the earth, who guided you in striking down the head of the leader of our enemies! For today, He has so magnified your name that your praise will never depart from the mouths of men, who will forever remember the power of God. Amen, amen.

verses.latin: Ut autem silentium factum est in castris, et Holofernes vino nimiæ crapulæ pondere oppressus, jacebat in lecto suo:
verses.english: When silence finally settled in the camp, Holofernes was weighed down by excessive wine and drunkenness, and he lay passed out on his bed.

verses.latin: vocavit Judith abram suam, et exivit de cubiculo, sicut in diebus singulis faciebat. Credens enim Bagoas Judæam dormire, et ad Holofernis non esse.
verses.english: Judith called her maidservant and went out of the bedroom, just as she did every other day. This was because Bagoas believed the Jewish woman was asleep and not with Holofernes.

verses.latin: Et clausit Judith ostium cubiculi sui, et stans ante faciem illius, oravit voce magna, dicens: Domine Deus omnis virtutis, respice in hanc horam, et adimple illam.
verses.english: Judith closed the door of her private room, and standing before God, she prayed with a loud voice, saying, "Lord God, You who possess all power, look upon this very hour and bring about my purpose."

verses.latin: Et confregit virtutem inimicorum meorum, et adimple propositum meum: quoniam in te est omnis virtus mea, et in tuis dispositionibus omnis potestas mea.
verses.english: "Break the power of my enemies, and fulfill my plan. For all my strength is in You, and all my authority depends on Your arrangements."

verses.latin: Et cum orasset haec, venit ad tentorium Holofernis, et accepit gladium ejus, qui pendebat super lectum ejus:
verses.english: After she had prayed these things, she came to Holofernes’ tent and took his sword, which was hanging over his bed.

verses.latin: et stans super caput ejus, detexit caput illius, et accepit gladium suum,
verses.english: And standing over his head, she uncovered his head, and she took her sword—meaning, she firmly grasped his sword, which was now her instrument.

verses.latin: et percussit eum in cervicem suam bis, et amputavit caput ejus. Et accepit caput ejus, et dedit illud abræ suae:
verses.english: And she struck him twice in his neck, severing his head. She then took his head and gave it to her maidservant.

verses.latin: et illa posuit illud in pera sua: et exierunt secundum morem suum, ut essent in orationibus. Et transierunt castra, et ascenderunt in montem.
verses.english: The maidservant put the head into her bag. Then they both exited according to their custom, as if they were going out for prayers. They passed through the camp and ascended the mountain.

verses.latin: Cumque essent in castris, venerunt ad portam civitatis. Et dixit Judith portariis: Aperite mihi portas civitatis, et ego ostendam vobis caput Holofernis, principis omnis exercitus Assyriorum.
verses.english: When they were still in the camp but had reached the city gate, Judith said to the gatekeepers, "Open the city gates for me, and I will show you the head of Holofernes, the commander of the entire Assyrian army."

verses.latin: Et cum aperuissent portae, et intrassent civitatem, vocavit Judith omnem plebem, et ostendit illis caput Holofernis, dicens:
verses.english: After the gates were opened and they had entered the city, Judith called all the people together and showed them Holofernes' head, saying:

verses.latin: Ecce caput Holofernis, ducis omnis exercitus Assyriorum, et ecce vela ejus, in quibus jacebat in ebrietate sua, et ecce me percussit illum in cervicem suam, et amputavit caput ejus.
verses.english: "Behold, the head of Holofernes, the leader of the entire Assyrian army! And look at his canopy, under which he lay in his drunkenness! And behold, I myself struck him in his neck and severed his head!"

verses.latin: Et dixit illis: Gratias agite Domino Deo vestro, qui vos hodie salvavit de manu inimicorum vestrorum, et dedit mihi in manus Holofernis.
verses.english: And she said to them, "Give thanks to the Lord your God, who has saved you today from the hand of your enemies, and who gave Holofernes into my hands."

verses.latin: Et omnis populus qui erat in Jerusalem, laudavit Dominum Deum suum, dicens: Benedictus es, Domine Deus noster, qui nos hodie salvasti de manu inimicorum nostrorum.
verses.english: And all the people who were in Jerusalem praised the Lord their God, saying, "Blessed are You, Lord our God, who has saved us today from the hand of our enemies."

verses.latin: Et omnis plebs laudavit Dominum, et adoravit Deum, dicens: Amen, Amen.
verses.english: And all the people praised the Lord and adored God, saying, "Amen, Amen."

verses.latin: Dixit autem Judith ad omnes: Audite me, fratres: suspendite caput Holofernis super muros nostros.
verses.english: Judith then said to all of them, "Listen to me, brothers! We will hang Holofernes' head on our city walls."

verses.latin: Et erit omnis vir qui assumpserit arma, et omnis inhabitans civitatem, conveniat in unum, et simul exeat quasi ad hostes a filiis Israël profecturus.
verses.english: "Then, every man who takes up weapons, and every person living in our city, should gather together. And you must all go out as if you are about to attack the enemies of the sons of Israel."

verses.latin: Ut fugiant hostes, ad comprehendendum principes Assyriorum, et tendant ad castra Assyriorum.
verses.english: "The goal is for the enemy to flee, so that we can capture the leaders of the Assyrians and advance towards their camps."

verses.latin: Et erit cum duces eorum viderint caput Holofernis, in fugam se convertent, et per aquas et pedes fugientes, vosque insequentes.
verses.english: "When their commanders see Holofernes' head, they will instantly turn and flee. They will try to escape by any means, over land and across the waters, and you must pursue them."

verses.latin: Haec autem cum docuisset eos, præcepit ut facerent quæ locuta est.
verses.english: After Judith had taught them these things, she commanded them to do exactly what she had told them.

verses.latin: Ascendit itaque Judith super muros, et suspendit caput Holofernis in murum. Et omnis vir assumpsit arma, et convenerunt secundum quod locuta fuerat ei.
verses.english: So Judith went up onto the city walls and hung Holofernes' head there. Then, every man took up his weapons, and they gathered just as she had instructed them.

verses.latin: Et factum est cum mane illuxisset, suspenderunt in murum arma sua, et exierunt omnes in unum, quasi impetum facientes in castra Assyriorum.
verses.english: And it happened that when the morning light appeared, they displayed their weapons on the wall, and all of them went out together, making it seem as if they were launching an attack on the Assyrian camps.

verses.latin: Et speculatores videntes eos, cucurrerunt ad præpositos suos, et annuntiaverunt eis.
verses.english: The Assyrian scouts saw them and immediately ran to their superiors, announcing what they had observed.

verses.latin: Qui cum perrexissent ad tabernaculum Holofernis, et non invenissent eum, nuntiaverunt principibus eorum:
verses.english: When these superiors went to Holofernes' tent and did not find him, they reported it to their commanders.

verses.latin: Qui perrexerunt ad tabernaculum ejus, et steterunt circumstantes, et clamaverunt ad ostiarium, qui jacebat ante cortinam tabernaculi, dicentes: Aperi, et ingredere, et nuntia domino tuo:
verses.english: So the commanders went to Holofernes' tent. They stood around it and called out to the doorkeeper, who was lying before the tent's curtain, saying, "Open the tent, go inside, and tell your master:"

verses.latin: Suscitavit enim te inimicus, et egressus est in insultationem tui, sicut mulieres fornicatrices.
verses.english: "Your enemy has woken you up, and he has gone out to insult you, behaving like a loose woman."

verses.latin: Et non est qui moveat, aut aperiat, sed dormiunt in uno. Erat enim Bacuæ inebriatus, et omnes ministri ejus.
verses.english: No one could stir him or open the tent, for they were all asleep together. Holofernes' eunuch, Bagoas, was drunk, as were all of his servants.

verses.latin: Et exierunt cum Bacuæ, et intraverunt in tabernaculum, et invenerunt eum jacentem super torum, cadaver putre.
verses.english: So the commanders went with Bagoas and entered the tent. They found Holofernes lying on his bed, a decaying corpse.

verses.latin: Et statim exclamaverunt, et scissa veste sua, exierunt ad principem et omnes duces ejus.
verses.english: And immediately, they cried out in alarm. Tearing their clothes, they rushed out to their general and all his commanders.

verses.latin: Et annuntiaverunt eis quod jacebat Holofernes mortuus, et caput ejus amputatum.
verses.english: They announced to them that Holofernes was lying dead, and his head had been cut off.

verses.latin: Et exclamavit omnis dux et universi principes Assyriorum, et timuerunt valde, et tremuerunt, et scissa veste sua, exierunt ad omnes castrorum suorum.
verses.english: Every general and all the leaders of the Assyrians cried out in dismay. They were terrified and trembled with fear. Tearing their clothes, they rushed out to every part of their camps.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt quod Holofernes occisus est, et duces eorum mortui, et scissæ vestes eorum. Et omnes in unum, timuerunt valde, et tremuerunt, et contremuerunt, et parati sunt ad fugam, et non audentes se mutuo ad loquendum.
verses.english: They announced that Holofernes had been killed, and their leaders were dead, and their clothes were torn in lament. All of them together were extremely afraid, and they trembled and quaked with terror. They prepared to flee, not daring to speak to one another.

verses.latin: Sed omnes simul, sicut uno impetu, quasi ad fugam, et dimittentes omnia quæ in castris erant, quasi ad fugam.
verses.english: Instead, everyone, as if in a single rush, prepared for flight. They abandoned everything that was in their camps as if they were fleeing for their lives.

verses.latin: Et cum scirent, quod Holofernes occisus est, fugerunt per vias, et per montes, et per omnes valles, et per omnes semitas, et per omnes castrorum suorum. Et omnes qui fugerunt, salvati sunt. Et illi qui remanserant in castris, cæsi sunt ab illis qui fugerant.
verses.english: And when they knew that Holofernes was killed, they fled by the roads and through the mountains, and through all the valleys, and along all the paths, abandoning all their camps. All who fled were saved. But those who had remained in the camps were killed by the very ones who had fled, in the chaos of their desperate rout.

verses.latin: Haec audientes, inimici nostri fugerunt, et coeperunt currere in omnes vias campestres et montanas. Illi quoque qui erant in castris, audientes exercitum Judæorum capto et occiso Holoferne, fugerunt.
verses.english: Upon hearing the news of Holofernes’ death, our enemies immediately fled. They began to run in every direction across the plains and into the mountains. Those who were still in the Assyrian battle-camps, upon hearing that the Judean forces had captured and killed Holofernes, also fled in a panic.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt omnes qui erant per colles et per montes, ab Assyriorum castris ad bellum. Tunc filii Israel, omnes qui poterant invenire arma, fugerunt in eos.
verses.english: All who were scattered among the hills and mountains from the Assyrian camps, abandoning their war effort, continued to flee. Then the children of Israel, all who could find weapons, rushed against them, pursuing the retreating army.

verses.latin: Et Olophernes cecidit in domo sua; et omnes exercitus ejus, qui ad portam civitatis Bethulia erant, fugerunt.
verses.english: Holofernes had fallen in his own tent. And all of his army who had been besieging the gate of the city of Bethulia fled at once.

verses.latin: Tunc Joacim sacerdos magnus, et seniores Israelis, qui habitabant in Jerusalem, venerunt ad Bethuliam, ut viderent Judit et salutarent eam.
verses.english: Then Joakim, the High Priest, and the elders of Israel who lived in Jerusalem came to Bethulia to see Judith and greet her with honor.

verses.latin: Et omnes viri ejus, et omnes mulieres civitatis suæ, venerunt ad eam. Et cum venisset ad eam, benedixerunt eam omnes unanimiter, dicentes: Tu es gloria Jerusalem, tu es lætitia Israel, tu es honor populi nostri.
verses.english: All the men and all the women of her city, Bethulia, came to her. When they had gathered, they all blessed her with one voice, saying: “You are the glory of Jerusalem! You are the joy of Israel! You are the honor of our people!”

verses.latin: Quia fecisti hæc omnia manu tua, et cum omnibus bonis fecisti Israel. Et hæc omnia fecisti in cordibus eorum, et in cordibus nostris: sit tibi in æternum benedictio.
verses.english: Because you did all these things by your own hand, you have brought great good to Israel. And you have stirred courage in their hearts and in our hearts with all these deeds. May a blessing be upon you forever.

verses.latin: Et clamavit omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: And all the people cried out, “Amen!”

verses.latin: Et omnes mulieres Israel convenerunt in unum ad eam, et benedixerunt eam. Et post dies aliquot venit Ozias princeps civitatis ad eam, et dixit ei:
verses.english: All the women of Israel gathered together around her and blessed her. After several days, Ozias, the ruler of the city, came to her and said to her:

verses.latin: Domina, benedicta tu a Domino Deo Israel, quia per te factum est hoc.
verses.english: “Lady, may you be blessed by the Lord God of Israel, because this great thing has been accomplished through you.”

verses.latin: Et respondit Judith ad eum: Vivit Dominus, quia per manum meam facta est victoria in Israel.
verses.english: And Judith responded to him: “As the Lord lives, victory has been achieved in Israel through my hand.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Ozias ad eam: Benedicta tu, filia, a Domino Deo Israel, quia fecisti hæc, et Dominus fecit in te virtutem, et exaltavit te, ut omnes homines te glorificent.
verses.english: And Ozias said to her: “Blessed are you, daughter, by the Lord God of Israel, because you did these things. The Lord empowered you and exalted your name, so that all people may glorify you.”

verses.latin: Et omnis populus dixit: Amen.
verses.english: And all the people said, “Amen!”

verses.latin: Et iterum dixit Ozias: Benedicta tu, filia, a Domino Deo Israel, quia per te facta est victoria in Israel.
verses.english: And again Ozias said: “Blessed are you, daughter, by the Lord God of Israel, because through you victory has been accomplished in Israel.”

verses.latin: Et post dies triginta reversa est ad domum suam, et non cognovit virum in omnibus diebus vitæ suæ, a die qua mortuus est Manasses vir ejus.
verses.english: After thirty days, she returned to her home. And she did not have a man intimately in all the days of her life, from the day her husband Manasses died.

verses.latin: Et facta est in dierum illorum, usque ad mortem. Et facta est in domo sua, usque ad centum quinque annos.
verses.english: She lived a life of honor and purity throughout those days, until her death. And she remained in her home until she was one hundred and five years old.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eam in sepulchro Manasses viri sui, et luctum fecerunt super eam dies septem.
verses.english: They buried her in the tomb of Manasses, her husband. And they observed a seven-day mourning period for her.

verses.latin: Et nemo conturbavit Israel in omnibus diebus vitæ Judith, et post mortem ejus, multis diebus.
verses.english: And no enemy attacked or troubled Israel in all the days of Judith’s life, and for a long time after her death.

verses.latin: Quod cum audissent omnes incola Judææ, quæ juxta erant, facta sunt eis quasi una mente, ut ad eos pergerent.
verses.english:
When all the inhabitants of Judea who were in the vicinity heard about the victory, they became as one mind.
They went out to meet the returning people.

verses.latin: Et exierunt universi de Bethlehem, et Bethmestim, et Bethoron, et Beli, et Cholæ, et Cades, et fluminis torrentis, et de civitate Magdeddi, et de campis, et convallibus, et ut simul occurrerent eis ad diem tertium in Bethuliam.
verses.english:
Everyone came out from Bethlehem, Bethmestim, Bethoron, Beli, Chola, Cades, the torrent stream, the city of Magdeddi, and from the fields and valleys.
They all went to meet them together, arriving in Bethulia on the third day.

verses.latin: Et omnes accipientes stolam, et viri, et mulieres, et parvuli Judæi in Bethuliam, ut benedicerent Judit, et visum facerent ei.
verses.english:
And all the Jews in Bethulia—men, women, and children—came out, each one wearing their best cloak.
They wanted to bless Judith and see her.

verses.latin: Et venerunt omnes et benedixerunt eam una voce, dicentes: Tu gloria Jerusalem, tu lætitia Israël, tu honorificentia populi nostri:
verses.english:
And all of them came, and with one voice they blessed her, saying:
'You are the glory of Jerusalem! You are the joy of Israel! You are the honor of our people!'

verses.latin: quia fecisti hæc omnia manu tua, sicut bona opera fecit Israël: benedicaris tu in æternum.
verses.english:
'For you have done all these things by your own hand, just as Israel has performed great deeds.
May you be blessed forever!'

verses.latin: In diebus illis, omnes populi in Bethulia, benedicebant eam, cum gaudio, et lætitia, et tripudio.
verses.english: In those days, all the people in Bethulia blessed her with joy, gladness, and dancing.

verses.latin: Et protulerunt omnes viri Israelis (illi scilicet qui pugnaverant) spolia, capientes Holofernis, quæcumque illius fuerant, de argento, et auro, et vestimentis, et vasis, et omni supellectili: et dederunt omnia Judit.
verses.english:
And all the men of Israel—namely, those who had fought—brought out the spoils they had taken from Holofernes.
This included all his silver, gold, garments, vessels, and all his furnishings. They gave everything to Judith.

verses.latin: Et omnes populi lætati sunt, et epulati sunt cum lætitia, in conspectu sanctorum, et per dies triginta.
verses.english: And all the people rejoiced and feasted with gladness in the presence of the holy people for thirty days.

verses.latin: Tamen et quæcumque erant Holofernis, dedit illa templo Domini in Jerusalem, et spolia omnia Holofernis.
verses.english:
However, Judith gave everything that had belonged to Holofernes to the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem.
This included all his spoils.

verses.latin: Populus autem perlætabatur in Bethulia de Judit, et lætus erat omnis Israël.
verses.english: The people in Bethulia rejoiced exceedingly because of Judith, and all of Israel was filled with joy.

verses.latin: Deinde congregati sunt omnes sacerdotes ab Jerusalem et omnes seniores Israelis venerunt, ut viderent bona quæ fecerat Dominus Israeli, et ut loquerentur Judit, et ut benedicerent eam.
verses.english:
Then all the priests from Jerusalem gathered, and all the elders of Israel came.
They came to see the good things the Lord had done for Israel and to speak with Judith and bless her.

verses.latin: Et quieverunt a bello diebus multis, et adierunt Jerusalem in sanctificationem.
verses.english:
And they rested from war for many days.
Then they went to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices of thanksgiving and purification to God.

verses.latin: Et ascendit in Jerusalem Judit cum omnibus bonis Holofernis quæ dederat illi populus, et imposuit omnia vota Domini, et omnia vota populi.
verses.english:
And Judith went up to Jerusalem with all the goods of Holofernes that the people had given her.
She dedicated all the offerings to the Lord and presented all the vows made by the people.

verses.latin: Et vidit omnis populus eam, et benedicebant eam, et mirabantur, et omnis dies eius erat benedictionis, in diebus Israel.
verses.english:
And all the people saw her, and they blessed her, and they marveled at her.
Every day of her life was a blessing in the days of Israel.

verses.latin: Et permansit Judit in Bethulia multis diebus, et omnes quæ illius erant, in Bethulia permanserunt.
verses.english:
And Judith remained in Bethulia for many days.
All those who belonged to her household also remained in Bethulia.

verses.latin: Et non cognovit virum usque ad mortem suam.
verses.english:
And she did not have intimate relations with a man until her death.
This means she remained a widow.

verses.latin: Et reliquit omnia sua ancillæ suæ, et omnia sua domui suæ, et omnia quæ acceperat de Holoferne, et quæcumque fuerant illius.
verses.english:
And she left all her possessions to her handmaid, and all her wealth to her own house and family.
She also left everything she had received from Holofernes, and everything that had belonged to him.

verses.latin: Et facta est in omni tempore honorata, et honorifice vixit in diebus suis omnibus in Bethulia.
verses.english:
And she was honored at all times.
She lived honorably all her days in Bethulia.

verses.latin: Et non erat in diebus illis, aut multis temporibus, qui turbaret Israël post mortem Judit.
verses.english: And there was no one in those days, or for many years after, who disturbed Israel after the death of Judith.

verses.latin: Tunc cantavit Judith canticum hoc Domino, dicens:
verses.english: At that time, Judith sang this song to the Lord, as she said:

verses.latin: Incipite Domino in tympanis, cantate in cymbalis, modulamini illi in psalmis et laudibus: quia defecit os novum ab illo:
verses.english: Start a new song to the Lord with drums, sing to Him with cymbals, play for Him with psalms and praises, for a new song has burst forth from Him.

verses.latin: Dominus enim conterens bella, Dominus nomen est illi.
verses.english: For the Lord is the One who crushes wars. Lord is His very name.

verses.latin: Qui posuit castra sua in medio populi sui, ut eruat nos de manu omnium inimicorum nostrorum.
verses.english: He has established His presence among His people, so that He might deliver us from the power of all our enemies.

verses.latin: Venit Assur de montibus ab aquilonem, in multitudine fortitudinis suae: cujus multitudo obturavit torrentes, et equi eorum cooperuerunt valles.
verses.english: Assyria came from the mountains to the north, with a mighty army. Its vast numbers blocked the rivers, and their horses covered the valleys of the land.

verses.latin: Minatus est transire fines meos, et interficere juvenes meos gladio: infantes meos dare in praedam, et virgines in captivitatem.
verses.english: Holofernes threatened to invade our land and kill our young men with a sword. He planned to give our infants as plunder and our virgins into captivity.

verses.latin: Sed omnipotens Dominus, contrivit illos, et dedit eos in manus mulieris, et corruerunt illi.
verses.english: But the Almighty Lord crushed them. He gave them into the hands of a woman, and they were defeated.

verses.latin: Non enim ceciderunt potentes eorum a juvenibus, neque filii Titan percusserunt illos, nec gigantes magni imposuerunt super eos.
verses.english: Their powerful warriors did not fall by the hand of young men, nor did the strong, legendary giants strike them down. No mighty heroes attacked them.

verses.latin: Sed manus Judith filiae Merari percussit illum in vulnere, et cecidit in fugam:
verses.english: Instead, the hand of Judith, daughter of Merari, struck him with a fatal blow, and he fell, causing his army to flee.

verses.latin: quia omnis virtus ejus, sicut aqua tabescet.
verses.english: For all his strength and power would melt away like water.

verses.latin: Ascendit Holofernes in castra sua, et omnes principes ejus, et ministri ejus:
verses.english: Holofernes was in his own camp, along with all his generals and his officers.

verses.latin: Et coeperunt clamare ad invicem, et dicere: Quis est iste qui nos audebat?
verses.english: Then they began to cry out to one another, asking, "Who is this person who dared to attack us in this manner?"

verses.latin: Et factum est ut fugerent de castris, et omnes qui erant cum illis.
verses.english: And so it happened that they, and all who were with them, fled from the camp.

verses.latin: Et cecidit super eos timor et tremor, et conturbatio, et cito discederent in via deserti.
verses.english: Fear, trembling, and utter confusion overcame them, and they quickly departed, scattering into the desert.

verses.latin: Et filii Israel, qui cum ipsis erant in castris, secuti sunt eos usque in fines Assyriorum.
verses.english: And the children of Israel, who were present at the camp, pursued the Assyrians all the way to the borders of their land.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt, et obtinuerunt omnia quae reliquerant illi.
verses.english: They returned, taking possession of everything the Assyrians had left behind.

verses.latin: Et sanctificaverunt dies festos, et obtulerunt Domino sacrificium, et laudaverunt Deum, quia salvavit eos.
verses.english: And they consecrated feast days, offered sacrifices to the Lord, and praised God, because He had saved them.

verses.latin: Et factum est, ut post dies multos, transiret ab eis Holofernes, et omnes principes ejus, et ministri ejus.
verses.english: And it happened that after many days, Holofernes and all his generals and officers had completely passed away from any influence over them, and were no longer a threat.

verses.latin: Et factum est ut abirent filii Israel cum gaudio magno, et laetitia, et in omnibus laudibus, et gratiarum actionibus Domino.
verses.english: And so the children of Israel departed with great joy and gladness, giving all praises and acts of thanksgiving to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et obtulerunt Domino sacrificia, quia salvavit eos de manu inimicorum suorum, et non erant amplius inimici in omnibus finibus eorum.
verses.english: They offered sacrifices to the Lord because He had saved them from the power of their enemies, and there were no longer any enemies within all their borders.

verses.latin: Et factum est, ut filii Israel manerent in Jerusalem, et celebrarent diem festum.
verses.english: And so the children of Israel remained in Jerusalem, celebrating the feast day.

verses.latin: Et Judith fuit valde in honore in omnibus diebus vitae suae, et nemo erat qui de illa diceret verbum malum.
verses.english: Judith was greatly honored throughout all the days of her life, and no one ever spoke an evil word against her.

verses.latin: Et factum est ut post obitum Judith, nemo superaret populum suum, in omnibus diebus vitae suae, et in diebus liberorum suorum.
verses.english: And it came to pass that after Judith's death, no one overcame her people throughout all the days of her descendants.

verses.latin: Et dedit Deus illi ut requiesceret in pace, et non esset in omnibus finibus eius bellum, et esset in omnibus diebus vitae suae, et in diebus liberorum suorum.
verses.english: And God granted her to rest in peace, and there was no war within all of her people's borders throughout all the days of her life and the days of her descendants.

verses.latin: Et abiit in domum suam, et mansit ibi annos multos, et mortua est in Bethulia, et sepelierunt illam in sepulchro patris sui.
verses.english: And she returned to her own house and remained there for many years. She died in Bethulia, and they buried her in her father's tomb.

verses.latin: Hymnum cantemus Domino, hymnum novum cantemus Deo nostro.
verses.english: Let us sing a hymn to the Lord; let us sing a new hymn to our God.

verses.latin: Adjuva nos et glorificare in nomine tuo: qui dissipas bella ab initium.
verses.english: Help us to glorify Your Name, O Lord, for You have destroyed wars from the beginning of time.

verses.latin: Dominus, qui concutit bella, sanctum nomen ejus.
verses.english: The Lord shatters wars, and His Name is holy.

verses.latin: Qui ponit castra inter populum suum, eripit animam meam de manibus insidiantium.
verses.english: He who places His camp among His people, snatches my life from the hands of those who plot against me.

verses.latin: Assur venit de montibus ab aquilonem, in multitudine fortitudinis suae, in multitudine militum ejus: quorum multitudo obtexit valles, et equitatus ejus superavit colles.
verses.english: Assyria came from the northern mountains, with the might of its great strength and a multitude of its soldiers. Their numbers covered the valleys, and their cavalry overran the hills.

verses.latin: Dixit enim, quod comburet fines meos, et adolescentes meos gladio occidet, et infantes meos in terra collidet, et parvulos meos in praedam dabit, et virgines meos in captivitatem ducet.
verses.english: For he said he would burn my lands, kill my young men with the sword, dash my infants to the ground, give my little children as plunder, and lead my virgins into captivity.

verses.latin: Dominus autem omnipotens contrivit illum, et tradidit eum in manus feminae.
verses.english: But the Lord Almighty crushed him and delivered him into the hands of a woman.

verses.latin: Non enim in viris glorificatur Deus, nec in fortibus armorum, sed in humilibus et modestis laudatur Dominus salvans.
verses.english: For God is not glorified by the strength of men, nor by mighty warriors, but the saving Lord is praised among the humble and meek.

verses.latin: Excitat enim Dominus scutum in gentem suam, et ponit metum suum in omnibus nationibus.
verses.english: For the Lord raises a shield for His people, and He places His fear upon all nations.

verses.latin: Qui excitat gentes, et destruit eos, quorum consilium fuit, ut conturbaret populum suum.
verses.english: He stirs up nations and destroys those whose plan was to trouble His people.

verses.latin: Assur in furore venit, in fortitudine exercitus sui, in equitatu ejus, in quadriga ejus, in multitudine pugnatorum ejus: et non sunt digni, ut respiciant ad Dominum Deum.
verses.english: Assyria came in fury, with the strength of its army, with its cavalry, its chariots, and a multitude of its fighters. Yet, they were not worthy to look upon the Lord God.

verses.latin: Dominus enim omnipotens est nomen ejus, qui contrivit eos in pulverem ante faciem ancillae suae.
verses.english: For the Lord Almighty is His Name, and He crushed them into dust before His handmaid.

verses.latin: Non solum Holofernem, sed et exercitum ejus in pulverem redegit; et ex omnibus, qui cum eo venerant, nemo evasit.
verses.english: Not only Holofernes, but also his army, He reduced to dust. And of all who came with him, no one escaped.

verses.latin: Deus meus, laudabo te: quoniam omnes virtutes ejus sunt in te.
verses.english: My God, I will praise You, because all virtues and powers are found in You.

verses.latin: In te laetabitur anima mea, et in gaudio exultabo in te, quoniam non est alius Deus absque te.
verses.english: My soul will rejoice in You, and in joy I will exult in You, for there is no other God besides You.

verses.latin: Novum cantabo canticum Deo meo: Dominus meus magnus est, et gloriosus in fortitudine sua.
verses.english: I will sing a new song to my God; my Lord is great and glorious in His strength.

verses.latin: Quoniam novum cantavit canticum Domino, et non est in terra sicut Deus noster.
verses.english: For a new song has been sung to the Lord, and there is no one on earth like our God.

verses.latin: Dominus enim extollit humiles, et humiliat superbos.
verses.english: For the Lord exalts the humble and humbles the proud.

verses.latin: Non est qui te laudet, Dominus omnipotens, quoniam tu es Deus omnipotens.
verses.english: There is no one who can adequately praise You, O Lord Almighty, for You alone are the Almighty God.

verses.latin: In tempore tribulationis invocabo te, et tu me eripies.
verses.english: In times of tribulation, I will call upon You, and You will rescue me.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnia sunt in te, et omnis potestas, et omnis virtus tua.
verses.english: For all things are in You, and all power, and all Your might.

verses.latin: Novum canticum, et novum laudem cantemus Deo nostro.
verses.english: Let us sing a new song and new praise to our God.

verses.latin: Magnificemus nomen ejus, quoniam ipse est Deus noster, et non est alter praeter eum.
verses.english: Let us magnify His Name, for He Himself is our God, and there is no other besides Him.

verses.latin: Confundantur omnes, qui in te superbientes sunt: confundantur in aeternum.
verses.english: Let all who are proud against You be put to shame; let them be put to shame forever.

verses.latin: Et dissipet eos in ignem et sulphur, et omnis terra adoret eum.
verses.english: And let Him scatter them with fire and brimstone, and let all the earth adore Him.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnia sunt opera tua, et in tua potestate sunt: et in tua voluntate sunt omnia quae sunt.
verses.english: For all things are Your works, and they are in Your power, and all things that exist are in Your will.

verses.latin: Dominus enim est qui facit judicium in omni terra.
verses.english: For the Lord is He who executes judgment throughout all the earth.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus, in cuius voluntate sunt omnia quae sunt: et in cuius conspectu omnis caro conturbatur.
verses.english: Lord God, in whose will all things that exist are, and before whose sight all flesh is troubled.

verses.latin: In judicio tuo superabunt omnes inimici tui: et in ira tua exurgent omnes inimici tui.
verses.english: In Your judgment, all Your enemies will be overcome, and in Your wrath, all Your enemies will rise up (only to be destroyed).

verses.latin: In ore tuo gladium posuisti, et in manibus tuis ignem:
verses.english: In Your mouth You have placed a sword, and in Your hands, fire.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnis creatura serviet tibi, et omnis spiritus honorificabit te: quoniam tu es Dominus Deus noster, et non est alter praeter te.
verses.english: For every creature will serve You, and every spirit will honor You, because You are our Lord God, and there is no other besides You.

verses.latin: Woe genti impiae, quia impie egerunt: et abominabitur eas in aeternum Dominus.
verses.english: Woe to the wicked nation, for they have acted wickedly, and the Lord will abhor them forever.

verses.latin: Et in die judicii, ignem et vermes mittet in eos: ut doleant in aeternum.
verses.english: And on the day of judgment, He will send fire and worms upon them, so that they may suffer forever.

verses.latin: Non est qui te laudet, Dominus omnipotens, quoniam tu es Deus omnipotens.
verses.english: There is no one who can adequately praise You, O Lord Almighty, for You alone are the Almighty God.

verses.latin: In hoc jubileo laetabitur anima mea, et in gaudio exultabo in te, quoniam non est alius Deus absque te.
verses.english: In this celebration, my soul will rejoice, and in joy I will exult in You, for there is no other God besides You.

verses.latin: Novum canticum cantabo Deo meo, quoniam non est in terra sicut Deus noster.
verses.english: I will sing a new song to my God, for there is no one on earth like our God.

verses.latin: Dominus enim est qui contrivit superbos, et in tua potestate sunt omnia quae sunt.
verses.english: For the Lord is He who crushed the proud, and in Your power are all things that exist.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnis creatura serviet tibi, et omnis spiritus honorificabit te: quoniam tu es Dominus Deus noster, et non est alter praeter te.
verses.english: For every creature will serve You, and every spirit will honor You, because You are our Lord God, and there is no other besides You.

verses.latin: Et in judicio tuo superabunt omnes inimici tui: et in ira tua exurgent omnes inimici tui.
verses.english: In Your judgment, all Your enemies will be overcome, and in Your wrath, all Your enemies will rise up (only to be destroyed).

verses.latin: In ore tuo gladium posuisti, et in manibus tuis ignem: ut doleant in aeternum.
verses.english: In Your mouth You have placed a sword, and in Your hands, fire, so that they may suffer forever.
